Job Description


Come intern with one of the largest engineering companies in the world.

Join us to develop new technology that will provide Intel a competitive advantage in programmable solutions. If you find it exciting to work in a diverse team that innovates with other Intel advanced technology groups, with other industry leaders and academia, then we have your opportunity.

The Intel Programmable Solutions Group (PSG) has been delivering industry-leading custom logic solutions to customers since inventing the world's first reprogrammable logic device in 1984. To expand the technology that provides us with advantages in programmable solutions, we are looking for a phenomenal intern to join our high-powered team.

As a member of INTEL’s PSG Tools and Methodology group, you will be responsible for the development of tools, methodologies, and processes to support Intel's next generation FPGA technology and products.

Candidates will participate in the implementation of Design Intellectual Property (IP) development flows working with RTL simulators, synthesis and timing analysis tools. Individuals will routinely be involved with troubleshooting design and verification issues of complex IP design flows and tools.

Behavioral Traits:

  • Verbal and written communication skills.

  • Work under minimal supervision.

  • Independently identify, troubleshoot and solve problems.

To start Summer 2021. Preferable 12-month full-time internship.


Qualifications


You must possess minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates. Experience listed below would be obtained through a combination of your school work/classes/research and/or relevant previous job and/or internship experiences.

This position is not eligible for employment-based visa/immigration sponsorship. Intel sponsors individuals for employment-based visas for positions where we experience a shortage of US Workers. These skills shortage roles are typically STEM contributing positions requiring a Master's or PhD degree, or a Bachelor’s degree with three years’ related job experience. This position does not qualify for Intel Sponsorship because it is either (1) a non-STEM contributing position, or (2) a STEM position that only requires a Bachelor’s degree and less than three years’ experience.

Minimum Requirements:
The candidate must be pursuing a Bachelor's degree in Computer Engineering, Engineering Science, Computer Science, Math, Electrical Engineering or related field.

Minimum of 3+ months experience in:

  • Programing languages C/C++ and/or Python.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • At least one course in digital logic.

  • Experience using FPGA.

  • Exposure to web based development tools.

Inside this Business Group


The Programmable Solutions Group (PSG) was formed from the acquisition of Altera. As part of Intel, PSG will create market-leading programmable logic devices that deliver a wider range of capabilities than customers experience today. Combining Altera's industry-leading FPGA technology and customer support with Intel's world-class semiconductor manufacturing capabilities will enable customers to create the next generation of electronic systems with unmatched performance and power efficiency. PSG takes pride in creating an energetic and dynamic work environment that is driven by ingenuity and innovation. We believe the growth and success of our group is directly linked to the growth and satisfaction of our employees. That is why PSG is committed to a work environment that is flexible and collaborative, and allows our employees to reach their full potential.

Virtual US and Canada

position: Summer Internship – Software Engineer Computer Programming Intern
description:
Company Description


Interco is a global recycling company headquartered on the Illinois-side of St. Louis in Madison. The company has been an industry leader providing metals, computers and electronics recycling services with a focused track record of innovation and integrity in since 1996.

The 400,000+ sqft. Interco Metaltronics recycling facility is comprised of five buildings on more than 40 acres centrally located on the Illinois-side of St. Louis in the shadows of the Gateway Arch. The facility boasts a 145,000 sqft. processing plant dedicated to the processing of computers, electronics, and batteries with the remainder of the indoor facility used for the processing of nonferrous industrial metals.

The company specializes in the placement of smelter-ready materials catering to commercial, industrial, dealer, and government organizations nationwide. Interco ships nonferrous and electronics scrap worldwide utilizing established partnerships with end consumers in the United States, Europe, Latin America and Asia.

The Interco team — consisting of commercial, logistics, administrative, and operations departments — delivers innovative solutions, competitive pricing, and quality service throughout the supply chain.

https://www.intercotradingco.com


Job Description


The Software Engineer/Computer Programming Intern works as part of the IT department to code, develop, update, and manage the company’s proprietary programs and more than fifty websites. Together with the IT Administrator and the Webmaster, this person will help design and create software programs while integrating systems and software. The right candidate will help modify the source-code of existing proprietary Interco software and learn to write system instructions and assist with the training of on premises end-users.

The coding languages utilized at Interco include CSS, PHP, Python, HTML, Java, and JavaScript, among others. The Software Engineer/Computer Programming Intern should be familiar with Access and MySQL as well as Apache Spark, SSH, and XHTML. This intern will assist the IT team to help debug programs and maintain operating systems. The right candidate must have at least a basic understanding of Linux and general IT security.

This position requires an acute attention to detail and the ability to stay focused to troubleshoot existing code and communicate issues with others in the IT department including the IT Administrator and Webmaster. The right candidate will have an analytical mind and an understanding of technology infrastructures using CSS, Firewalls, IDS/IPS, Web-Proxy and Security Audits. Top candidates are expected to display attention to detail and problem-solving skills and the desire to work hard and contribute while learning in a fast-paced environment.

The Software Engineer/Computer Programming Intern should be able to work well in a team, collaborating with managers, designers, writers, etc. and be a detail-oriented person eager to learn. This person should demonstrate the ability to follow clear instructions and an interest in improving existing coding skills while learning new strategies and languages while gaining hands-on experience with computers, networking, and peripherals.

Day to Day Tasks Include:

  • Help modify the source-code of existing proprietary Interco software.
  • Write code for software, software patches, and bug fixes.
  • Develop and write computer programs to perform specific tasks related to organizational goals.
  • Create workflow diagrams and charts to demonstrate the functionality of programs.
  • Work with team members to find creative, innovative solutions to problems.
  • Help the Interco team develop software system validation and testing methods.
  • Assist with the development of program documentation and assist with the training of on premises end-users.
  • Work with IT Admin and Webmaster to communicate project statuses and key project data to team members.
  • Analyze data to effectively coordinate the installation of new systems or the modification of existing systems.
  • Help IT team to monitor system performance.
  • Communicate with and build cohesion with fellow team members.
  • Assist with the development and execution of project plans.
  • Apply best practices and standard operating procedures.
  • Create innovative solutions to meet the Interco technical needs.
  • Test new software and run tests to spot and resolve bugs and inconsistencies.

Qualifications
  • Hands-on programming experience using relevant languages such as CSS, PHP, Python, HTML, Java, JavaScript, and more.
  • Experience using relevant tool suites.
  • Strong written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Must have excellent creative problem-solving skills.
  • Strong attention to detail and ability to spot tiny errors or inconsistencies in code.
  • Familiar with Access and MySQL as well as Apache Spark, SSH, and XHTML.
  • Detail-oriented person with a passion to learn.
  • Up to date on the latest software innovations and committed to continually building on existing knowledge and skills.
  • Exemplify superior time management skills and capable of working productively with minimal supervision.
  • Be able to work well in a team, collaborating with managers and team members.
  • Ability to follow directions closely and accurately.
  • A desire to innovate and create cutting edge programs.
  • Basic Linux and IT security experience.
  • Desire to learn to troubleshoot website issues.
  • Strong attention to detail with an analytical mind and good problem-solving skills.
  • Terrific time management skills with the ability to multi-task.
  • Must be naturally driven to produce high quality results with great care
  • Current in Computer Science, IT, Systems Engineering or a related qualification preferred.
  • Recent graduates with degrees in Computer Sciences or related fields may be eligible as well.

Additional Information


Other

  • Pay rate: $12 / hour
  • Consistent work schedule 20-40 hours/week
  • Term of internship 2-3 months
  • This position does not offer healthcare benefits
  • This position is open to local students only

Physical Demands and Abilities

  • Occasionally required to stand, walk, stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl
  • Occasionally required to sit and climb or balance
  • Occasionally lift and/or move objects 10-50 lbs.

As a matter of company policy, we do not sponsor employment visas or hire from out of the USA nor do we sponsor candidates who do not currently reside within the USA without an existing H-1B visa.

This job description is designed to provide a general overview of the requirements of the job and does not entail a comprehensive listing of all activities, duties or responsibilities that will be required. Interco Trading Company reserves the right to modify this job description at any time; including assigning or reassigning job duties or eliminating this position at any time.

Candidate information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Work remotely: No

Overview:
NV5 (NASDAQ: NVEE) is a provider of engineering and consulting services to public and private sector clients, delivering solutions through six business verticals: Testing, Inspection & Consulting; Infrastructure; Utility Services; Environmental Health Sciences; Buildings & Program Management; and Geospatial Technology. With offices nationwide and abroad, NV5 helps clients plan, design, build, test, certify, and operate projects that improve the communities where we live and work.

As engineers, architects, construction/program managers, environmental professionals and beyond, we play a significant role in shaping our communities through the services we provide. We are looking for passionate, driven individuals to join our team focused on Delivering Solutions and Improving Lives.

Responsibilities:
Job Summary:
Assist engineers and designers in the development and production of engineering plans and specifications on a variety of projects. The systems designed at NV5 include Electrical, HVAC, and Fire Protection and Plumbing systems for a wide variety of building types.

  • Lay out engineering drawings using AutoCAD/Revit. Transfer the design from verbal or written instructions to CAD/Revit under the supervision of an engineer, senior engineer or project manager.

  • Formal training in AutoCAD and Revit preferred.
  • Must have excellent verbal and written communication skills along with familiarity with Microsoft Products such as Excel and Outlook.

The employee frequently sits or stands in the same location with opportunity to move about; occasionally walks substantial distances at job site locations; regularly thinks, concentrates, analyzes, interprets, interacts with others, and communicates orally and in writing; regularly uses a computer (keyboard and mouse); regularly reads, sees, hears, and speaks; frequently uses hands to write, type, finger, handle, or feel; occasionally reaches with hands and arms; occasionally bends, stoops, and lifts or moves up to 30 pounds (and greater weights infrequently); occasionally climbs ladders and stairs.

Job Description

At Citadel Securities, Software Engineers design, develop, and maintain the advanced technology that powers our firm and allows us to challenge the impossible in trading.

As an intern, you’ll get to challenge the impossible in technology through an 11 week program that will allow you to collaborate and connect with senior team members and our CEO Peng Zhao. In addition, you’ll get the opportunity to network and socialize with peers at iconic venues.

Your Objectives:

· Create technological tools that bring trading strategies to life

· Develop high-performance, large data research platforms

· Work in small teams to build the future of finance

Opportunities available in Chicago, New York, London

About Citadel Securities

Citadel Securities is a leading global market maker across a broad array of fixed income and equity securities. Our world-class capabilities position us to meet the liquidity demands of our diverse group of institutional clients in all market conditions. In partnering with us, our clients, including asset managers, banks, broker-dealers, hedge funds, government agencies and public pension programs are able to gain a powerful trading advantage and are better positioned to meet their investment goals.

The team makes its mark every day from our offices around the world: Chicago, New York, London, Hong Kong, Toronto, Shanghai, Sydney, Dublin.

Zoomies help the world connect — and deliver happiness while doing it. We set out to build the best video conferencing product for the enterprise, and today help people communicate better with products like Zoom Phone, Zoom Rooms, Zoom Video Webinars, Zoom Apps, and OnZoom.

We’re problem-solvers and self-starters, working at a fast pace to design solutions with our customers and users in mind. As a Software Engineering Intern , you will have opportunities to work across our stack, developing software ranging from Web Server to business application layer for our distributed, cloud-hosted backend. The program offers cutting edge projects, as well as a mix of additional types of learning in areas of leadership and business acumen - and is packed full of fun! Our goal is to provide our interns with world-class managed experiences, so we can ensure happiness occurs every step of the way!

Four billion people do not have access to the internet. Astranis is going to change that. We are building the next generation of smaller, lower-cost telecommunications satellites to bring the world online.

Come work with incredibly smart people who have flown things in space before. No prior space experience needed, you just need to enjoy getting your hands dirty with real hardware and be okay with struggling to do things that seem impossibly hard.

We’re a well-funded team of over 100 world-class engineers that move fast. We raised our Series B ($90M) from Andreessen Horowitz and Venrock, launched our first satellite in 2018, secured our first major customer deal in 2019, and we’ll triple the satellite internet capacity of Alaska in 2021.

Our mission and our products are meant to connect the world and everyone in it, regardless of gender, race, creed, or any other distinction. We believe in a diverse and inclusive workplace, and we encourage all people to join our team and bring their unique perspective to help make us stronger.

As a computer vision software intern, you will be joining a small, tightly knit group of engineers & designers committed to solving niche and specific problems in the sports space. In addition to the real world experience and the opportunity to work with an amazing group of dedicated engineers and designers, many of our previous interns either became full-time team members or moved on to work for companies like Google, Epic Games, Amazon and Lockheed Martin.

Position Summary:

  • BioFire Defense, LLC, is looking to hire a Data Analyst Intern. This position is a part-time or full-time, nonexempt position. The Data Analyst Intern will be part of a dynamic team performing a variety of activities related to collecting data, conducting data analysis, and reporting results. This intern will assist the Data Analyst with organizing, analyzing, interpreting, and summarizing data. This position requires some programming skills to develop and maintain scripts that are easily understandable to others. Specific tasks vary and the culmination of a task may include writing a study or giving a presentation to an individual, team, or the company. Will be responsible for communicating methodology to individuals with little to no mathematics background. Will help explain mathematics and statistical principles to co-workers.

Principal Job Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Perform all work in compliance with Company policy and within the guidelines of BioFire Defense’s Quality System.
  • Assist the Data Analyst in providing input and review on design, implementation, and analysis of studies (including clinical studies), protocols, verifications, validations, troubleshooting and other testing efforts.
  • Assist Data Analyst to compute and advise on sample size and other statistical methodologies.
  • Assist Data Analyst on designing or oversight of summary tables, reports, graphs, etc., for presentation of results.
  • Fully document statistical and analysis explanations/descriptions.
  • Assist Data Analyst to advise, provide support, and provide training, talks, etc., as needed on statistical concepts.
  • Asist in creating and modifying software programs to support the job functions as described above.
  • Check and verify statistical programs, data sets and summary tables as requested.
  • Use professional concepts in accordance with Company objectives to solve complex problems in creative and effective ways.
  • Ensure lab notebooks for assigned projects/experiments are utilize as necessary, and in accordance with Company policy.

Training and Education

  • Requires enrollment in a 2-year Associates Degree or bachelor’s program in Mathematics, Statistics Data Science or other applicable field.

Experience/Skills/Physical Requirements:

  • 0-3 years in Mathematics, Statistics Data Science or other applicable field.
  • Some knowledge of programming language used in the field, such as R, Python, Matlab, etc.
  • Some knowledge of statistical tests and their applications (T-tests, chi-square, F-Tests).
  • Ability to learn quickly and to adapt and accept changing priorities.
  • Good documentation practices, organizational skills, and time management.
  • Good critical thinking and problem-solving skills.
  • Good verbal and written communication skills.
  • Desire to work collaboratively as well as independently.
  • Preferred:
    • Biochemistry, biological chemistry, or molecular biology knowledge
    • Familiarity with databases and query languages (e.g.SQL)
    • Familiarity with source control (version control)
    • Some knowledge of advanced statistical techniques (sample size determination, experimental design, etc.)
    • Must be able to safely lift 50 lbs.

Benefits/Compensation:

  • We offer competitive salaries
  • Vacation/holiday pay
  • Medical benefits
  • Stimulating work environment

Join Intel-and build a better tomorrow. Intel is in the midst of an exciting transformation, with a vision to create and extend computing technology to connect and enrich the lives of every person on Earth. So join us-and help us create the next generation of technologies that will shape the future for decades to come.

Intel Labs is an industry leading research organization, responsible for identifying and exploring compelling new technologies, product ideas and high risk opportunities ahead of business unit investment. We explore, refine and demonstrate new technologies and innovative new usages for the computing technology ahead of the market. Intel Labs engages the leading thinkers in academia and industry in addition to partnering closely with Intel business units.

Human and AI Systems Research, also known as HAR, is a team in Intel Labs that is focused on multi-disciplinary research spanning ethnography, UX design, HCI and AI to create Human-AI collaborative systems that can amplify human potential and create sustainable and transparent AI solutions . We utilize multi-modal signals e.g. vision, audio, speech, language , RF and AI to infer and predict human state and actions and enable physically situated dialog and interactions. We conduct this research in the context of vertical domains including manufacturing, education, enterprise, and assistive computing for people with disabilities.

HAR is currently seeking a highly motivated intern in the field of user experience research. We are looking for someone who is curious about the role of AI in people's lives, how AI might drive new types of user experience, as well as potentially create new kinds of challenges for people of all kinds. In terms of skills, we are looking for someone who is able to plan, initiate, and conduct user interviews, conduct participatory design sessions or other forms of creative and generative user engagement, as well as to contribute to prototyping and user testing to refine and hone our ideas and concepts.

We're constantly working on making a more connected and intelligent future, and we need your help. Change tomorrow. Start today.


Qualifications


You must possess the below minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Experience would be obtained through a combination of prior education level classes, and current level school classes, projects, research, and relevant previous job and/or internship experience.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Must be enrolled in a graduate program in design, anthropology or other fields in the social sciences, or disciplines relating to human-computer interaction, with a focus on user studies

  • 1+ year experience conducting user research, including ethnographic observation or interviews, user testing, and/or participatory design

  • 1+ year experience with common prototyping tools such as Figma, InVision, or Adobe

Inside this Business Group


Intel Labs is the company's world-class, industry leading research organization, responsible for driving Intel's technology pipeline and creating new opportunities. The mission of Intel Labs is to deliver breakthrough technologies to fuel Intel's growth. This includes identifying and exploring compelling new technologies and high risk opportunities ahead of business unit investment and demonstrating first-to-market technologies and innovative new usages for computing technology. Intel Labs engages the leading thinkers in academia and industry in addition to partnering closely with Intel business units.

position: Deep Learning Library Software Engineering Intern - Summer 2021
description:
We are looking for a Deep Learning Library Software Engineering Intern :

NVIDIA is hiring software engineers for its GPU-accelerated deep learning Libraries team. Academic and commercial groups are relying on GPUs to enable breakthroughs in many domains using deep learning, our deep learning libraries (such as cuDNN) is used by enterprise customers, developers and researchers to unlocks new advances in applications in visual systems, language processing, speech and many others. Join the team that is building the underlying software used across the world to power the revolution in artificial intelligence.

What you'll be doing:

In this role, you will be responsible for developing enterprise software, by applying modern software development and design practices on CPU and GPU codes to implement new features and building blocks, optimize existing functionality on existing and future hardware and develop performance tuning techniques. In addition you will collaborate with members of the deep learning software engineering organization at NVIDIA to deliver world leading software with unprecedented performance in deep learning using NVIDIA GPUS.

What we need to see:

  • You are pursuing a BS, MS, PhD or equivalent in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Applied Math, or related field.

  • You have the ability to work independently, define project goals and scope, and lead your own development effort.

  • You have strong C/C++ programming and software design skills, including debugging, performance analysis, and test design.

  • Familiar with CUDA/OpenCL GPU programming.

Ways to stand out from the crowd:

  • Demonstrate strong CUDA GPU programming skills.

  • Parallel programming experience, particularly with CUDA or OpenCL.

  • Numerical methods experience.

  • Knowledge of CPU/GPU architecture.

  • Python experience.

NVIDIA is widely considered to be one of the technology world’s most desirable employers with some of the most forward-thinking, inventive, and hardworking people working here - we need your help to build our future. Are you creative, ambitious, and love challenges? We want to hear from you!

NVIDIA is committed to fostering a diverse work environment and proud to be an equal opportunity employer. As we highly value diversity in our current and future employees, we do not discriminate (including in our hiring and promotion practices) on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender expression , sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or any other characteristic protected by law.

position: Computer Science Intern - Finance Summer Internship
description:
Company Description


Stratas Foods LLC is the leading supplier of fats and oils to the Foodservice, Food Ingredients and Retail Private Label markets in North America and is a producer of quality bulk and packaged dressings, mayonnaise and sauces. Stratas Foods was formed in October 2008 as a 50/50 joint venture between ACH Food Companies (ACH) and Archer Daniels Midland (ADM).

Manufacturing facilities are located in Dallas and Houston, TX; Decatur and Quincy, IL; Englewood, NJ; Fresno, CA; Nashville, TN; and Valdosta, GA. Corporate offices are located in Memphis, TN. We are committed to maintaining a progressive workplace by utilizing the ideas, skills and talents of all of our employees. We strive to make Stratas Foods a great place to work and are building a team capable of meeting our business goals.

The Stratas Finance Team has an exciting opportunity for a talented Information Computer Science intern to help build small scale applications. As an intern with Stratas Foods, you will not only work with and learn from industry professionals, but you will also share in the culture of teamwork at Stratas Foods.

As an intern, key responsibilities will include the following:

  • Conduct needs analysis
  • Build small scale applications for the finance department based on business needs
  • Work with the IT Department and Master Data Governance Team

Qualifications
  • An individual who has at least 1-2 years of undergraduate studies remaining
  • A concentration in Information Technology or related field
  • Application development background through any of the RAD (Rapid Application Development) softwares
  • Strong communication skills
  • A highly motivated self-starter
  • Strong organizational skills
  • Strong analytical skills
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite, specifically Excel and Macros
  • Proficient in SQL – Nice to have
  • Proficient in PowerBI – Nice to have
  • Critical Thinker

Additional Information


Competencies:

Communications – Strong negotiation and interpersonal skills in dealing with those both internal and external to Stratas are critical to success

Leadership - Ability to lead others in the directions necessary to achieve mutually beneficial goals is important

Analytical Skills – Having both the ability and competency to evaluate a variety of alternatives and pick the best solution in a dynamic work environment

Specialty:

Job Qualifications:

Student Intern - REACH
General Summary:
REACH Interns participate in a job shadowing career development summer session, Monday through Friday under the direct instruction of professionals from various departments within the RUMC facility, including: Medical Center Engineering, Clinical Engineering, Nursing units, Alzheimer Disease Center, LADS, Marketing and Communications/Graphic Design, Behavioral Sciences, etc. Interns learn how to perform job-specific tasks while gaining an understanding of day-to-day operations within their assigned department. Exemplifies the Rush mission, vision and values and acts in accordance with Rush policies and procedures.

Principal Duties and Responsibilities:
Medical Center Engineering: Students assist department staff as they operate, maintain, repair, inspect and upgrade/improve all of the Medical Center buildings and the related systems/equipment, for example: Electrical systems, Carpentry, Painting, HVAC, Plumbing, Inventory Control, etc.
Clinical Engineering: Students assist department staff with proper management of diagnostic, therapeutic, and life support equipment, including: new equipment inventory and safety test; maintain device histories of individual pieces of equipment; repair and scheduled maintenance of all patient diagnostic, therapeutic, and life support equipment here at Rush.
Nursing units: Students perform specific tasks in various units that assist in increased patient satisfaction and improved patient experience; units include: NICU, Case Management, OR, ER, Mother/Child, 9 North, Oncology outpatient, Child Psych/Day school, PAR, Interventional Radiology, Hospital Administration, etc.
Teaching Aid Assistant: Helps establish and maintain a safe and healthy learning environment, advance physical and intellectual competencies, support social and emotional development and provide positive guidance, establish positive and productive relationships with families, and maintain a commitment to professionalism.
Marketing and Communications/Graphic Design: Student assists department staff as they manage Rush's marketing, advertising and branding efforts. The office is responsible for public relations, including media relations and internal communications; and oversight of the University's and Medical Center's websites.
Alzheimer Disease Center: Under supervision, student conducts a variety of established functions to engage diverse communities in Alzheimer's disease outreach, education and research. The student will assist with outreach events and activities for older adults centered on the topics of healthy aging and Alzheimer's disease.
Information Systems: Student will perform simple projects using basic computer skills. Student will be an accountable team member, meet agreed deliverables and deadlines, and communicate clearly with peers and management.
Off-Site Locations: Under supervision, students will assist partnered organizations and other off-site Rush facilities with a variety projects, tasks, and engage with the community. Students will perform specific tasks as directed; organization includes: PAWS Chicago, Block Electric, Rush Oak Park, etc.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
Student must be enrolled in a undergraduate program
Preferred health science or STEM major
Should display high level leadership skills, work ethic, and appropriate ethical and professional behaviors
Should possess basic computer skills and knowledge
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Self-directed and able to work without supervision
Energetic and eager to tackle new projects and idea
Exceptional customer service skills; should be enthusiastic, friendly, dependable, and flexible

Company Highlights:
Rush was recently ranked first for Quality and Accountability among 102 leading academic medical centers in the US in a study conducted by the health care services company Vizient.
Ranked among the top academic medical centers in the country, Rush University Medical Center is an outstanding place to enhance your career. Everything we do centers on one goal: improving patient care.
Rush offers a competitive salary, and valuable healthy living benefits including: health, dental and vision to help you maintain and improve your health. Rush also offers several ways to invest in your future.

Rush is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics.

Software Developer Intern:


Do you like a challenge, are you a complex thinker who likes to solve problems? If so, then you might be the new Altairian we are searching for. At Altair, your curiosity matters. We pride ourselves on a business culture that enables open, creative thinking, and we deeply value our employees and their contributions towards our clients' success, as well as our own.

Job Summary:

As a Software Developer Intern, you will support the documentation teams by creating solutions to automate our processes and improve the user experience for external customers and internal stakeholders. We are transforming the way we write, publish, and deliver product documentation so that it is more modern and usable. We are seeking candidates who can adapt to changing priorities and maintain momentum on multiple projects, while bringing a dynamic, motivated, positive outlook to the team. Independence and initiative are critical, but diplomatic and collaborative efforts are also required in our diverse multi-cultural environment. As part of an engineering software company, you’ll be immersed in a high-tech culture and successful candidates will embrace new technologies and their innovative uses.


What You Will Do:

  • Update existing plugins for our publishing engine in the DITA Open Toolkit used to publish custom deliverables in webhelp and PDF formats. Implement using XML, XSLT, CSS, HTML, and JavaScript.
  • Implement automated weekly builds for the online help using Jenkins and our publishing engine. Manage the integration between Perforce, Jenkins, and the web server.
  • Work with the team to research and test prototypes for the next generation of help authoring tool software.
  • Improve speed and accuracy of local and online search engine in web-based help project.

What You Will Need:


  • Working towards a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Science, or a related field
  • Good programming and web development skills, proficiency in writing code and automation scripts
  • Self-motivated and dedicated to accomplishing objectives
  • Ability to work in a multicultural, distributed, and global environment and communicate with non-native English speakers
  • Advantage - working knowledge of:
  • CSS and JavaScript frameworks like AngularJS, Bootstrap, and jQuery
  • Python or similar programming languages

How You Will Be Successful:

  • Envision the Future
  • Communicate Honestly and Broadly
  • Seek Technology and Business “Firsts”
  • Embrace Diversity and Take Risks

What We Offer:

  • Competitive Salary
  • Training & Development - free training on Altair products

Why Work with Us:

Altair is a global technology company that provides software and cloud solutions in the areas of product development, high-performance computing (HPC) and artificial intelligence (AI). Altair enables organizations in nearly every industry to compete more effectively in a connected world, while creating a more sustainable future. With more than 3,000 engineers, scientists and creative thinkers in 25 countries, we help solve our customer’s toughest challenges and deliver unparalleled service, helping the innovators innovate, drive better decisions, and turn today’s problems into tomorrow’s opportunities.


Our vision is to transform customer decrision making with data analytics, simulation, and high-performance computing and artificial intelligence (AI).


For more than 30 years, we have been helping our customers integrate electronics and controls with mechanical design to expand product value, develop AI, simulation and data-driven digital twins to drive better decisions, and deliver advanced HPC and cloud solutions to support unlimited idea exploration. To learn more, please visit altair.com.

Ready to go? #ONLYFORWARD


At our core we are explorers; adventurers; pioneers. We are the brains behind some of the world’s most revolutionary innovations and are not only comfortable in new and uncharted waters, we dive in headfirst. We are the original trailblazers that make the impossible possible; discovering new solutions to our customer’s toughest challenges.

Altair is an equal opportunity employer. Our backgrounds are diverse, and every member of our global team is critical to our success. Altair's history demonstrates a belief that empowering each individual authentic voice reinforces a culture that thrives because of the uniqueness among our team.

At HPE, we bring together the brightest minds to create breakthrough technology solutions and advance the way people live and work. Our legacy inspires us as we forge ahead dedicated to helping our customers make their mark on the world.

Learning does not only happen through training. Relationships are among the most powerful ways for people to learn and grow, and this is part of our HPE culture. In addition to working alongside talented colleagues, you will have many opportunities to learn through coaching and stretch assignment opportunities. You’ll be guided by feedback and support to accelerate your learning and maximize your knowledge.

You’ll be part of HPE storage ( Primera team). HPE Primera delivers the agility of the cloud and raises the bar on resiliency and performance, so you can enable innovation without compromise. Built upon proven resiliency and powered by HPE InfoSight, HPE Primera delivers instant access to data with storage that sets up in minutes, upgrades transparently, and is delivered as a service. Ensure always fast and always on storage for all mission-critical apps, backed by a 100% Availability Guarantee.

Responsibilities:

  • Analyze, design, program, debug, and modify software enhancements and/or new products in Intelligent storage and Cloud
  • Write code and complete programming by using C,C++, Python
  • Perform testing, debugging of storage features , data path and storage efficiency
  • Linux USER space IO development and debug
  • Interact with users to define system requirements and/or necessary modifications
  • Effectively communicate product architectures, design proposals and negotiate options at management levels
  • Collaborate with peers, senior engineers and architects
  • Typically interact with high-level individual contributors, managers and program core teams

Education and skill set:

  • Competed an undergraduate degree and enrolled in a Graduate program studying Computer Science, Information Systems or equivalent
  • Strong hands on C programming and debugging skills
  • Strong hands on Linux kernel/user mode multiprocessor, multithreaded programming
  • Distributed systems knowledge is – strong plus
  • Good at partnering, innovating, and making things happen. You are aligned to our core values
  • A professional with strong analytical and problem solving skills
  • Experienced in software application design tools and programming languages
  • Excellent in verbal and written communication and presentation

We offer:

  • A competitive salary and extensive social benefits
  • Diverse and dynamic work environment
  • Work-life balance and support for career development
  • An amazing life inside the element! Want to know more about it?

Then let’s stay connected!

Summary of Job Purpose:
Internship opportunity to work with a team to execute specific projects and receive on the job training while gaining professional experience.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
o This person will work with executive leadership to understand and define requirements of our leadership management system and process in order to tailor our IT tools to support simple, effective, and efficient monitoring and control of our key performance indicators (KPIs). Our management system includes a regular process to set goals, measure performance against those goals, and take action to control our performance. These KPIs include such things as sales, gross margin, R&D spend, staffing, on-time delivery, quality, and more.
o This work can be broken up into discrete projects, which can be started and completed during this internship.
o This position will also work with leadership to lay out the vision and roadmap of future expansion of the IT tools and management system to meet the business needs.
o This person will also work with others across different sites in Southern California, Texas, and Mexico to ensure their underlying KPI's are consumable by the IT tools for the Executive Leadership KPI's and management system.
o Current IT tools include SAP, Power BI, excel, powerpoint, and we welcome additional recommendations.
o This role will also include the rollout and training of users

Complementary description

Physical Requirements :
Office
o While performing the duties of this Job, the employee is regularly required to sit; use hands to finger, handle, or feel and talk or hear. The employee is frequently required to reach with hands and arms. The employee is occasionally required to stand and walk.
o The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 10 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision.
o The noise level in the work environment is usually quiet.

Job requirements

Required Competencies:Education / Experience:
o Currently pursuing a Bachelor's or Master's degree from an accredited college or university in Engineering or Computer Science
o Legally authorized to work in the US without company sponsorship
o This position requires use of information or access to hardware, which is subject to the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR). All applicants must be U.S. persons within the meaning of ITAR. ITAR defines a U.S. person as a U.S. Citizen, U.S. Permanent Resident (i.e. 'Green Card Holder'), Political Asylee, or Refugee
o Fulfill all Environmental, Safety & Health requirements and act in a safe and environmentally responsible manner at all times. This includes, following all ES&H policies and procedures, acting on unsafe conditions and aiding Leadership in the attainment of ES&H initiatives and continuous improvement efforts.

Skills and Abilities:
o Strong Mathematics and Statistics knowledge
o Excellent oral and written communication skills
o Dependability - Ensures that all details of a project are accurate before delegating to others.
o Detail Orientation - Rarely makes errors but accepts responsibility for those that are made and develops a plan to prevent similar errors from recurring.
o Listening - Consistently practices attentive and active listening and can accurately restate the opinions of others.
o Relationships - Develops relationships with others that are based on trust.
o Time Management - Works from a daily to-do list but will re-organize if priorities suddenly shift. Ability to make timely decisions even if the face of complexity, balancing systematic analysis with decisiveness

Company information
Safran Electronics & Defense

Safran is an international high-technology group, operating in the aviation (propulsion, equipment and interiors), defense and space markets. Its core purpose is to contribute to a safer, more sustainable world, where air transport is more environmentally friendly, comfortable and accessible. Safran has a global presence, with 79,000 employees and sales of 16.5 billion euros in 2020 and holds, alone or in partnership, world or regional leadership positions in its core markets. Safran undertakes research and development programs to maintain the environmental priorities of its R&T and Innovation roadmap.
Safran ranks first in Forbes's 2020 list of the World's Best Employers for its sector.
Safran Electronics & Defense is a world leading supplier of products and services that handle observation, decision and guidance functions for both civil and military applications. The company understands and applies a wide range of the state-of-the-art technologies that underpin embedded intelligence in many different areas, as a supplier to some of today's most innovative aerospace and defense programs.

Solenis is a leading global producer of specialty chemicals for water-intensive industries, including the pulp, paper, oil and gas, chemical processing, mining, biorefining, power and municipal markets. Position Overview:

This part-time, temporary role will assist our development teams in producing scalable software solutions. They will be part of a cross-functional team that’s responsible for the full software development life cycle, from conception to deployment.

The ideal candidate should have had some exposure to both front-end and back-end coding languages, development frameworks and third-party libraries.

Essential Job Functions:

  • Working within the defined Software Development Life Cycle process, coding standards and best practices
  • Improving existing programs by analyzing and identifying areas for improvement
  • Supporting Quality Assurance in testing, bug fixing and eliminating defects
  • Prepare test data and executes detailed test plans.
  • Maintain very good working knowledge of the supporting application(s), development environments and the supported client environment.
  • Understand and adhere to the Company's risk and regulatory standards, policies and controls in accordance with the Company's Risk Appetite.
  • Works under the guidance of senior development team members to develop, document, test, and debug new and existing software systems and/or applications for market sale or large-scale proprietary software for internal use.
  • Uses Microsoft .NET Framework and supporting programming languages (e.g., Visual C#, JavaScript, T-SQL).
  • Supports, maintains, and documents software functionality.
  • Analyzes code to find causes of errors and revise programs as needed.
  • Ensure software satisfies all non-functional requirements such as quality, security, modifiability, stability, etc.
  • Such other duties as assigned by your manager

Qualifications/ Requirements:

  • Actively pursuing Bachelor’s degree or equivalent from four-year College or technical school in a Computer Science, Software Engineering or related field
  • Working knowledge of Microsoft SQL Server, Visual Studio Development Software and Microsoft Office Suite
  • Working knowledge of programming and systems analysis procedures
  • Demonstrates attention to detail, accuracy, and thoroughness
  • Strong organization, administrative and documentation skills
  • Ability to work independently and creatively, learn quickly, and solve complex problems in high-pressure situations
  • Adapts to every changing environment and changes approach or method to best fit the situation
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Special Requirements:

  • The employee may be required to report to a different local office as a normal, contemplated, and mandated incident of their employment

Working Conditions:

  • Office environment with frequent computer, mouse, keyboard use
  • Alternating between sitting or standing as needed
  • Hearing, talking, reaching, grasping


This position is available in all US Remote locations as detailed in SitusAMC’s Telecommuting policy. Colorado locations are currently excluded for this posting.

Since 2006, 23andMe's mission has been to help people access, understand, and benefit from the human genome. We are a group of passionate individuals pushing the boundaries of what's possible to help turn genetic insight into better health and personal understanding.

Design and implement new features

Help write content and integration tests

Performs other related duties as assigned

Experience with SEO

23andMe, Inc. is the leading consumer genetics and research company. Our mission is to help people access, understand and benefit from the human genome. The company was named by MIT Technology Review to its "50 Smartest Companies, 2017" list, and named one of Fast Company's "25 Brands That Matter Now, 2017". 23andMe has over 5 million customers worldwide, with ~85 percent of customers consented to participate in research. 23andMe is located in Sunnyvale, CA. More information is available at www.23andMe.com .

At 23andMe, we value a diverse, inclusive workforce and we provide equal employment opportunity for all applicants and employees. New America’s Resource Security Program seeks applicants for a summer research fellowship. The fellowship will be part of a policy exercise to test a conflict prediction model being developed by the Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency (DARPA). This is a five-week paid internship/fellowship (July 26th—August 27th, 2021).

About the fellowship:

The research fellows will participate in one week of training and preparation, including background research in relevant topic areas, followed by four weeks of user testing of the decision support tool. There may also be opportunities for contributing to blogs or reports on the project. This position is remote, but candidates should indicate whether they are flexible about possibly attending training in person or working on site if that becomes possible.

Tasks and Responsibilities:

  • Attending all training sessions.
  • Conducting literature reviews and background research on key topics, to include peacebuilding, conflict studies, and food security.
  • Regular meetings with other testers, supervisors, and project sponsors.
  • Analytical testing of policy problem use case, with data collection.
  • Written reports or other materials on observations.

About the Project:

New America is collaborating with DARPA’s World Modelers program on this project. World Modelers aims to develop technology that integrates qualitative causal analyses with quantitative models and relevant data to provide a comprehensive understanding of complicated, dynamic national security questions. World Modelers analyses are intended to be timely enough to recommend specific actions that could avert crises, but also allow policymakers to test investments and ideas. The first use case of World Modelers is food insecurity resulting from the interactions of multiple factors, including climate, water availability, soil viability, market instability, and physical security.

Required Qualifications:

  • Currently enrolled in or recently graduated from a Masters program in Computer Science, Statistical/Mathematical modeling, Public Policy, Security Studies, Diplomatic Studies, Conflict Studies, International Development, Agricultural Economics or a related field. You don’t need to be an expert in mathematical modeling or foreign policy, but you do need a record of familiarity and experience with the former and interest in the latter.
  • Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to work in a team-oriented, diverse environment.
  • High level of attention to detail and accuracy of work.
  • Ability to communicate well, in writing and verbally.

Additional Skills (a plus, but not required):

  • Familiarity with modeling complex social, economic, and natural systems, such as drought, famine, and food security.
  • Familiarity with qualitative and quantitative causal analysis.
  • Interest in national security and environmental issues.

About the Resource Security Program:

New America's Resource Security program looks at the intersection of security, prosperity, and natural resources, or "natural security." We seek to promote understanding and innovative public policy ideas, actions, and partnerships. For more information, please visit our website at https://www.newamerica.org/resource-security/

Application Process:

To apply, please submit a resume and one-page cover letter explaining your qualifications and interests. Applications will be reviewed and accepted on a rolling basis through May 30, 2021.

No phone calls, emails or letters please.

Quantum AI Software Intern

Boston, Massachusetts; Toronto, Canada; Remote

About Zapata

Zapata computing is a software, services, and applications company whose mission is to advance humankind with revolutionary science and engineering by delivering quantum advantage to enterprise customers. We develop quantum-ready algorithms, applications, and solutions built on a workflow-based platform for enterprise data analytics.

We are committed to creating an environment that accelerates our employee’s growth and positive impact in the world. Our Quantum AI team is highly collaborative and cross-disciplinary to meet the fast-changing field. Our world-class quantum researchers and engineers are creative, curious, and resourceful problem solvers with a revolutionary mindset.


About the job

The Zapata Quantum AI team is building a portfolio of next-generation quantum machine learning tools and algorithms to be deployed on state-of-the-art hardware through Orquestra, Zapata’s workflow management platform. As a Quantum AI Software Intern, you will work with the team to design, develop, productionize, and maintain these algorithms and tools. A few examples of the Quantum AI team’s recent work:

  • Quantum-inspired models for enhanced combinatorial optimization (arXiv:2101.06250).
  • Generative modeling with quantum-classical hybrid architectures (arXiv:2012.03924).
  • Data-driven initialization and analysis techniques for parametrized quantum circuits (arXiv:2103.08572).

Internships during summer 2021 are preferred, but later dates will be considered on a case-by-case basis. Although internships can be performed remotely from any location and at flexible work hours, interns will be expected to be available on occasions during U.S. Eastern Daylight Time (EDT) or Central European Summer Time (CEST) working hours.


Responsibilities

  • Design, develop, product-ionize, and maintain quantum AI tools and algorithms and integrations with quantum computing libraries.
  • Support researchers at Zapata who use the tools that you build.

Team values

  • Cooperation in prioritization of work, science, and engineering decisions.
  • Team success as a shared accomplishment with diversity in thought and experience.
  • Open communication and willingness to respectfully engage with others.

Minimum qualifications

  • Currently enrolled in B.Sc., M.Sc., or Ph.D. program in computer science, physics, math, or related technical field.
  • Experience developing software for technical computing, especially in Python or Julia.

Preferred qualifications

  • Familiarity with fundamental concepts in quantum computing.
  • Familiarity with quantum computing frameworks such as Qiskit, Cirq, pyQuil, Q#, or machine learning libraries such as TensorFlow and PyTorch.
  • Experience developing complex technical software as part of a team.
  • Someone who is a self-starter, adaptable, and ready to learn.

If you’re looking to be at the forefront of disrupting the ecommerce industry, wanting to make your mark and be continuously challenged to grow, your time has come.

ShipBob is recognized as #1 on Crain's 2020 “Fast 50” list of the fastest-growing companies in Chicago & Built In's best mid-sized companies to work for in Chicago. With this growth, we are looking for top talent to help us reach the next level

Role Description:

As a Software Engineer 1 at ShipBob, you will be working within a team writing software to support ShipBobs mission.

About Us:

ShipBob is a tech enabled 3PL that partners with over 5,200+ e-commerce businesses to help them be more successful online. We offer a full suite of fulfillment solutions for our merchants, including the ability to improve their transit times, shipping costs and deliver best in class experience to their customers. With almost 100% accuracy rate in fulfilling orders and orders shipped on time, our merchants can count on us to deliver excellent service.

ShipBob’s growing fulfillment network is powered by our proprietary technology and acts as a back office for logistics, providing merchants with full visibility into orders, inventory levels in real time, and access to advanced analytics, over 27 integrations and data reporting.

As one of the fastest growing tech companies in Chicago with over $130M+ raised from blue-chip investors like Menlo Ventures, Bain Capital Ventures, Hyde Park Venture Partners and SoftBank Vision Fund 2, our goal is to continue to be the #1 best fulfillment technology in the industry. To help us meet this standard, we are scaling our entire team and looking for people who share our core values and have an entrepreneurial mindset

About You:

At ShipBob, we’re looking for individuals who embody our core values:

  • Be Mission-Driven. We want team members that are passionate about helping entrepreneurs improve their business, and bring that passion every day.
  • Be Humble. We have ambitious goals, and our team members understand that success or failure depends on us working together and leaving egos at the door.
  • Be Resilient. Logistics is a complicated business. So is software. We value team members that never give up and keep iterating until a problem is solved.
  • Be a Creative Problem Solver. As a startup, we value smart, innovative solutions to complex problems. We fall in love with the problem, not our “favorite” solution.
  • Be Safety Minded. It’s not just talk; it’s the way you work.

What You’ll Do:

  • Focus on growing as an engineer, learning existing tools, resources and processes
  • Develops their productivity skills by learning source control, editors, the build system, and other tools as well as testing best practices
  • Capable of taking well-defined sub-tasks and completing these tasks
  • Developing knowledge of a single component of our architecture
  • Demonstrates they are a high energy individual
  • Effective in communicating status to the team
  • Exhibits Shipbob’s core values, focuses on understanding and living these values
  • Accepts feedback graciously and learns from everything they do

What You’ll Bring To The Table:

  • Computer Science knowledge
  • Excellent Communication
  • Excellent Problem Solving and Programmatic skills
  • Object oriented mindset
  • Ability to work quickly and collaboratively in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment

Nice To Haves:

  • A defensive coding mindset with knowledge of OWASP
  • A passion for QA and understanding that testing is not someone else’s responsibility
  • Ability to own small, well scoped features and implementation of these features
  • A passion for DevOps and an appreciation for continuous integration/deployment
  • Experience with the following: C#, ASP.NET MVC, Agile, Vue.js, SQL, JSON, REST & .Net
  • Experience with Azure DevOps and Azure Functions
  • Experience with Javascript fundamentals
  • Experience with Regional DB Concepts

We recognize that people come with a wealth of experience and talent beyond just the technical requirements of a job. If your experience is close to what you see listed here, please still consider applying. Diversity of experience and skills combined with passion is a key to innovation and excellence; therefore, we encourage people from all backgrounds to apply to our positions.

Perks and Benefits:

  • Medical, Dental, Vision & Basic Life Insurance
  • Variety of voluntary benefits, such as: short term disability
  • Weekly paycheck with paid overtime eligibility
  • $500 Quarterly Perfect Attendance Bonus Potential
  • KinderBob Daycare Stipend program
  • Paid Time Off & Sick Time Off
  • Referral Bonus Program
  • Fun Culture >>> Check us out on Instagram

position: Software Development Engineer Intern - Amazon Robotics - Summer 2021
description:
• Completion of at least junior year of degree program is required
  • Working towards B.S. degree or higher in Computer Science, Engineering, applied math or other algorithmic-centric discipline
  • Experience in one of the following languages: Java, Python, C++, or C

Are you inspired by invention? Is problem solving through teamwork in your DNA? Do you like the idea of seeing how your work impacts the bigger picture? Answer yes to any of these and you’ll fit right in here at Amazon Robotics. We are a smart team of doers that work passionately to apply cutting edge advances in robotics and software to solve real-world challenges that will transform our customers’ experiences in ways we can’t even imagine yet. We invent new improvements every day. We are Amazon Robotics and we will give you the tools and support you need to invent with us in ways that are rewarding, fulfilling and fun.

Amazon Robotics is seeking talented and motivated Software Engineers interns to design, develop and test software that controls and optimizes mobile-robotic fulfillment systems used by Amazon.com operations. Amazon Robotics software facilitates user workflows, robotic control and machine to user interfaces, advanced algorithms and mobile technology. Our Software Engineers experiment with disruptive technologies and integrate them within our current software solutions using agile methodologies in a collaborative team environment. Each Software Engineer Intern will have an assigned technical mentor to help with onboarding, as well as 1-1 guidance from their manager, and will work closely with other engineers.

Amazon Robotics SDE opportunities will be based in the Greater Boston Area, in our two state-of-the-art facilities in Westborough and North Reading, MA. Both campuses provide a unique opportunity for interns to have direct access to robotics testing labs and manufacturing facilities.

As a Software Engineer Intern, you will:
  • Identify and develop software solutions to current business problems
  • Work with your manager and team to create milestones and deliverables
  • Participate in daily scrums and reviews with development teams
  • Develop design documentation and lead reviews with other engineers
  • Write code and unit tests and integrate code with other software and hardware components
  • Prototype and test concepts or features, both through simulation tools and emulators and with live robotic equipment
  • Work directly with customers to test software prototypes and incorporate feedback
  • Utilize Amazon Robotics and Amazon engineering tools, processes and technologies

  • Experience with creative problem solving and articulating technical challenges and solutions
  • Exposure to any of the following concepts: AWS and other Web Technologies, schedulers, workflows, state machines, multi-threading, and networking protocols
  • Interest in Robotics including coursework or clubs

Help us grow into an ever-evolving marketplace. Seeking an eager Machine Learning Engineer Intern to help solve critical problems within our industry.

WHAT WE DO

Betterview is the only property data platform that informs every transaction for decision-makers who want to reduce risk, cost & waste in an increasingly competitive environment. We provide software and services that capture, organize, and analyze data for buildings and properties to unlock valuable insight. Our company is quickly becoming essential to every transaction by making every property thoroughly understood.

Every day, our team is focused on the needs of our customers. We strive to earn their trust by providing valuable, accurate insight that is important to their businesses. We provide our customers with information that is not only useful to their business decisions but is easy to use. We combine high quality human interactions with sleek, intuitive design and are pioneers on the journey alongside our customers, who are transforming the way they do business with data-driven decision-making.

THE OPPORTUNITY
Betterview is opening up exciting three-to-six-month-long internship opportunities on its machine learning team. We are looking for eager and enthusiastic people who are as passionate about solving tough problems as we are. As an intern, you will be able to participate in all parts of our process, from training computer vision models on aerial imagery to building out our machine learning infrastructure. Some of the critical problems we're solving are:

  • How can we keep improving our image classification and semantic segmentation models?
  • What additional value can we add by integrating other sources of information?
  • How can we better create and work with existing building footprints from aerial imagery?
  • How can we tell how well a property will interact with the upcoming storm season?
  • How will the property handle a brush fire in the near area?
  • How can we better determine the age of a roof?
  • How can we be more efficient about labeling and curating our training data?
  • How can we increase the speed and efficiency of predictions?

WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING

  • Training computer vision models to analyze buildings and properties, identify aspects of interest to insurance companies. You will work with datasets created and curated by the data science team.
  • Participating in efforts to expand and improve the existing machine learning code base. This includes adding to our dataset generation, training, and evaluation pipelines.
  • Identifying areas where Betterview should branch out and implement new machine learning systems and techniques
  • Exploring new techniques in computer vision. Follow the latest trends in computer vision and apply cutting-edge research to our challenges.
  • Evaluating classifiers and work with the data science team to promote the best models
  • Building and improving our code base

WHAT YOU WILL BRING TO OUR COMPANY


  • Experience training deep learning models for computer vision tasks
  • Knowledge of machine learning fundamentals, such as linear algebra, calculus, statistics, statistical learning, and pattern recognition
  • Understanding of machine learning design principles (e.g. training and validation, regularization, boosting, etc.)
  • Coding skills and good knowledge of computer science fundamentals (algorithms, data structures, time complexity)
  • Experience with and interest in working in Python
  • Experience with modern deep learning frameworks such as TensorFlow/Keras, PyTorch, or Jax
  • Experience with common data science tools, such as Jupyter Notebooks, numpy, pandas, scikit-learn
  • Interest in reading academic papers and trying to implement state-of-the-art experimental systems
  • Familiarity with modern deep learning architectures, such as ResNet, UNet, etc
  • Knowledge of imagery analysis techniques
  • Relevant degrees (especially advanced ones) are always a plus, but we know great machine learning engineers can come from all backgrounds.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Knowledge of data query and data processing tools (i.e. SQL).
  • Experience working with relational database tools such as PostgreSQL.
  • Experience working with cloud infrastructure (AWS, GCP, and Azure).
  • Experience with version control systems such as git/GitHub.
  • Publications in relevant conferences, such as CVPR, NeurIPS, ICCV, ICML, ICLR.
  • Experience with building footprint registration.
  • Experience with aerial imagery.
  • Experience writing production code.

WHAT WE PROVIDE

  • Hourly pay
  • Paid sick leave
  • Three to six months of valuable industry experience
  • Typical work schedule is Monday – Friday (8:30am-5pm)

position: Paid Internship - Embedded Software Engineer Intern
description:
About Intrepid Control Systems

Intrepid Control Systems focuses on providing high-quality computer software and hardware services and products for engineers in vehicle autonomy, connectivity, automotive Ethernet, and embedded engineering. Its customers include many of the global automakers and major tier one suppliers working on autonomous and connected vehicles.

Intrepid is a global provider of innovative tools for engineers in the vehicle networking, testing, and embedded engineering fields. Widely recognized for our neoVI, ValueCAN, and Vehicle Spy tools, we’ve also developed a new line of solutions for Automotive Ethernet devices for 1000BASE-T1 and 100BASE-T1/BroadR-Reach.

Proximity to customers has allowed Intrepid to provide excellent customer service. With offices in China, Japan, the United Kingdom, Germany, India, Japan, and Korea supplementing our US headquarters, Intrepid provides unparalleled support to its clients worldwide.

Internship Summary

The Embedded Software Intern will be able to work on the latest Automotive Technologies. The Intern in this position will be working on creating applications and demonstrations based on the Adaptive Autosar Platform and other automotive technology. The host development environment will be mostly Linux, and most of the targets will also be running embedded Linux.

If the intern in this position shows great promise they may get hired in our core Embedded Development with the Intrepid Core Engineering team.

Job Responsibilities

Responsibilities include:

  • Developing and integrating stacks and libraries to create applications and demonstrations of the technology
  • Work with C & C++ applications and development on target boards
  • Other duties as assigned

Skills & Knowledge

  • C, C++, CMAKE
  • Yocto
  • Bitbake
  • OpenEmbedded
  • Linux
  • Embedded development using various targets, Gitlab, Networking technologies (TCP, UDP, IP, Sockets), and working Opensource stacks and libs
  • CAN/CAN FD, Automotive Ethernet

Qualifications

  • Bachelors or Masters in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or Electrical Engineering
  • Previous projects and Experience using the skills mentioned above is a plus
  • Debugging skills
  • Work independently
  • Being able to read, analyze, learn, test, and document
  • Being able to solve problems
  • Very well organized
  • Be able to think critically

POSITION SUMMARY

The IT Specialist Intern will support IT assets by testing, assessing viability for everyday business/productivity use and helping with the on-boarding and off-boarding of employees assigned assets. Will assist in setup and troubleshooting of all employees assigned assets and give recommendations if repairs or replacements are required. Will work with iOS, Windows OS and Android OS devices. Will oversee the IT asset inventory management software and any helpdesk tickets. Will document calls/ticket issue resolutions for each designated helpdesk ticket. Will work under the direct supervision of the Help Desk Manager.

EXAMPLES OF WORK

· Assists callers with requests for information technology services, repair or support requests, complaints, and inquiries and direct to appropriate IT personnel via computer tracking system.

· Answers questions and resolves computer problems for clients in person, via telephone, or from a remote location.

· Updates records and documents information pertaining to it asset inventory.

· Documents user calls issue resolution and related processes and procedures.

· Supports common business and productivity software.

· Installs and configures computer systems and applications within the company.

· Responds to customer inquiries and assists in troubleshooting and resolving challenges.

· Actively updates, maintains, and monitors all aspects of computer networks.

· Resolves technical issues related to network interruptions.

· Attends in-person meetings with clients to analyze, troubleshoot and diagnose hardware problems.

· Maintains a working log detailed all required system updates as well as the date of completion.

· Organizes and files documentation pertaining to warranties and instructional guides for computer hardware.

· Assists management in creating training materials pertaining to computer troubleshooting and usage.

QUALIFICATIONS

Must work safely at all times. Must conform to all Shine Solar policies and procedures. Must operate a computer and answer phones. Must be able to maneuver in a constantly changing work environment with a positive attitude every day. Ability to learn and articulate technical information and convey to non-technical people. Excellent attention to detail and time management ability. Be professional with clients and staff. Personal and honest in dealing with management and staff. Passion for assisting others and command of troubleshooting techniques. Able to translate technical concepts into layman’s terms. Capable of working independently and with little oversight. Excellent written and verbal communication skills, particularly on the phone. Works well under pressure and meets tight deadlines. Highly computer literate with capability in email, MS Office, Excel and related business and communication tools. Ability to type 60+wpm a plus. Fantastic organizational and time management skills. Strong decision-making and problem-solving skills. Meticulous attention to detail. Ability to accurately follow instruction Clean background check and drug free. Work requires continual attention to details. Must exhibit excellence in Customer Service with all customers. To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions

EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE

High school diploma or general education degree (GED) and must be currently enrolled in technology related degree program such as Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Technology, or Industrial Engineering. Have and maintain a cumulative GPA of 2.75, with a 3.0 in the major field of study. Be able to work at least 20 hours a week during the school semester (40 hours during the summer)

NVIDIA's invention of the GPU in 1999 sparked the growth of the PC gaming market, redefined modern computer graphics, and revolutionized parallel computing. More recently, GPU deep learning ignited modern AI — the next era of computing — with the GPU acting as the brain of computers, robots, and self-driving cars that can perceive and understand the world. Today, we are increasingly known as “the AI computing company.” We're looking to grow our company, and build our teams with the smartest people in the world. Join us at the forefront of technological advancement.

NVIDIA is seeking an intern for the discovery and development of Deep Learning solutions for autonomous machines including robotics and real-time embedded applications. The individual will be responsible for the development and deployment of innovative AI IoT edge applications in the field of Computer Vision or natural language processing (NLP) on Jetson products. You will have chance to build your own innovative AI application from scratch which can start from gathering datasets, crafting data (sensor) pipeline, and building and deploying deep learning models.

What you’ll be doing:

  • Brainstorm ideas for computer vision and NLP applications on NVIDIA Jetson

  • Develop and experiment with deep learning models which can fit on embedded systems

  • Performance analysis and optimization using NVIDIA’s tools such as TensorRT

  • Build and deploy deep learning models on wheeled robots, robotic arms, etc.

What we need to see:

  • You are pursuing a PhD, MS, or BS in Computer Science or related field or equivalent experience

  • Proven experience working with at least one of the deep learning frameworks and programming languages such as Python, C++

  • Previous ROS background and PyTorch experience is a plus

  • Self-driven, motivated and enthusiastic to work on state-of-art machine learning tools

Ways to stand out from the crowd:

  • Strong self-initiative, interpersonal skills, and resourcefulness with new technology

  • Excellent problem solving and partnership

NVIDIA is committed to fostering a diverse work environment and proud to be an equal opportunity employer. As we highly value diversity in our current and future employees, we do not discriminate (including in our hiring and promotion practices) on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender expression , sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or any other characteristic protected by law.

We’re looking for a Systems Engineering Intern (July/August – Dec 2021) to join our North American Systems and Services team in Burlington, MA.

Working for Signify means being creative and adaptive. Our culture of continuous learning and commitment to diversity and inclusion creates an environment that allows you to build your skills and career. Together, we’re transforming our industry.

As the world leader in lighting, we’re constantly ahead of the curve. Through our leadership in connected lighting and the Internet of Things, we’re breaking new grounds in data analytics, AI, and smart homes, offices, cities and more!

Signify is one of the few companies in the world to achieve carbon neutrality and our next sustainability goals are even bolder: doubling our positive impact on the environment and society by 2025.

As a Systems Engineering Intern, you’ll be responsible for participating in customer projects through all phases from design to proposal through completion.

We’re on the lookout for forward-thinking innovators with a passion for sustainability. If you match this description, get in touch!

  • Build mock-ups and test bench setups to test and support various Signify control system architectures (once we are back in the Burlington office)

This internship/co-op could lead to an at-will full time role. Learning is fundamental to our culture. Through continuous learning, we are transforming the industry. You have the chance to learn every day, acquire new skills and perspectives through customized online programs, and on-the-job experiences.

See #SignifyLife through the eyes of our employees!

Who we are

Signify is the world leader in lighting. We provide professional customers and consumers with quality, energy-efficient LED lighting. And our lights, when connected, bring data to devices, apps and people – redefining what light can do and how you use it. Today, our innovations, such as LiFi – internet connectivity through light – and UV-C, solar and horticultural lighting, contribute to a safer, smarter, more sustainable world.

We’re operating in 74 countries with 32,000 people worldwide.
