If you’re looking to be at the forefront of disrupting the ecommerce industry, wanting to make your mark and be continuously challenged to grow, your time has come.

ShipBob is recognized as #1 on Crain's 2020 “Fast 50” list of the fastest-growing companies in Chicago & Built In's best mid-sized companies to work for in Chicago. With this growth, we are looking for top talent to help us reach the next level

Role Description:

As a Software Engineer 1 at ShipBob, you will be working within a team writing software to support ShipBobs mission.

About Us:

ShipBob is a tech enabled 3PL that partners with over 5,200+ e-commerce businesses to help them be more successful online. We offer a full suite of fulfillment solutions for our merchants, including the ability to improve their transit times, shipping costs and deliver best in class experience to their customers. With almost 100% accuracy rate in fulfilling orders and orders shipped on time, our merchants can count on us to deliver excellent service.

ShipBob’s growing fulfillment network is powered by our proprietary technology and acts as a back office for logistics, providing merchants with full visibility into orders, inventory levels in real time, and access to advanced analytics, over 27 integrations and data reporting.

As one of the fastest growing tech companies in Chicago with over $130M+ raised from blue-chip investors like Menlo Ventures, Bain Capital Ventures, Hyde Park Venture Partners and SoftBank Vision Fund 2, our goal is to continue to be the #1 best fulfillment technology in the industry. To help us meet this standard, we are scaling our entire team and looking for people who share our core values and have an entrepreneurial mindset

About You:

At ShipBob, we’re looking for individuals who embody our core values:

  • Be Mission-Driven. We want team members that are passionate about helping entrepreneurs improve their business, and bring that passion every day.
  • Be Humble. We have ambitious goals, and our team members understand that success or failure depends on us working together and leaving egos at the door.
  • Be Resilient. Logistics is a complicated business. So is software. We value team members that never give up and keep iterating until a problem is solved.
  • Be a Creative Problem Solver. As a startup, we value smart, innovative solutions to complex problems. We fall in love with the problem, not our “favorite” solution.
  • Be Safety Minded. It’s not just talk; it’s the way you work.

What You’ll Do:

  • Focus on growing as an engineer, learning existing tools, resources and processes
  • Develops their productivity skills by learning source control, editors, the build system, and other tools as well as testing best practices
  • Capable of taking well-defined sub-tasks and completing these tasks
  • Developing knowledge of a single component of our architecture
  • Demonstrates they are a high energy individual
  • Effective in communicating status to the team
  • Exhibits Shipbob’s core values, focuses on understanding and living these values
  • Accepts feedback graciously and learns from everything they do

What You’ll Bring To The Table:

  • Computer Science knowledge
  • Excellent Communication
  • Excellent Problem Solving and Programmatic skills
  • Object oriented mindset
  • Ability to work quickly and collaboratively in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment

Nice To Haves:

  • A defensive coding mindset with knowledge of OWASP
  • A passion for QA and understanding that testing is not someone else’s responsibility
  • Ability to own small, well scoped features and implementation of these features
  • A passion for DevOps and an appreciation for continuous integration/deployment
  • Experience with the following: C#, ASP.NET MVC, Agile, Vue.js, SQL, JSON, REST & .Net
  • Experience with Azure DevOps and Azure Functions
  • Experience with Javascript fundamentals
  • Experience with Regional DB Concepts

We recognize that people come with a wealth of experience and talent beyond just the technical requirements of a job. If your experience is close to what you see listed here, please still consider applying. Diversity of experience and skills combined with passion is a key to innovation and excellence; therefore, we encourage people from all backgrounds to apply to our positions.

Perks and Benefits:

  • Medical, Dental, Vision & Basic Life Insurance
  • Variety of voluntary benefits, such as: short term disability
  • Weekly paycheck with paid overtime eligibility
  • $500 Quarterly Perfect Attendance Bonus Potential
  • KinderBob Daycare Stipend program
  • Paid Time Off & Sick Time Off
  • Referral Bonus Program
  • Fun Culture >>> Check us out on Instagram

Reports To: VP of Engineering

position: Aircraft Protection Systems Co-op/Intern Fall 2021- ELSYS
description:
GTRI’s Cooperative Education (“co-op”) program offers you extensive opportunities to participate in diverse scientific and technological endeavors, use state-of-the-art equipment and rapidly improve your technical and leadership skills. The program allows you to alternate three semesters of full-time work at GTRI with semesters of full-time school.

The Electronic Systems Laboratory (ELSYS) currently seeks students to work in the Test Engineering Division (TEN) starting the fall of 2021.

Test Engineering Division (TEN) provides Test and Evaluation (T&E) capability for Electronic Warfare (EW), Avionics, and Radar Hardware-in-the-Loop (HITL) test systems. These systems provide high fidelity simulation and stimulation of real-time Electro-Optical/Infrared (EO/IR), Radio Frequency (RF), and Avionics environments for testing EW, Avionics, and Radar systems that are used to protect aircraft from ground and airborne threats.

This broad range of research will provide a solid foundation for the student as a future software engineer. The student will work under the guidance of GTRI researchers performing research in one of the following areas -

  • Sensing and processing broad bands of the electromagnetic spectrum
  • Creating a complex electromagnetic environment used to test Aircraft Protection systems
  • Automating test activities using budding technologies
  • Simulating engagement environments to replicate field activities

The student researcher will perform one or more of the following activities -
  • Data capture and analysis of RF analog and digital signals
  • System engineering tasks such as requirements design, test architecture and development, and performance analysis
  • System testing using custom test equipment as well as common equipment such as oscilloscopes and spectrum analyzers

Required Minimum Qualifications

Co-op
  • Pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or Electrical Engineering
  • Must have a 3.0 or higher GPA
  • Must be registered for co-op credit with your university (Co-op only)

Intern

  • Pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in Mechatronics Engineering, Computer Engineering, or Electrical Engineering
  • 3.0 or higher cumulative GPA
  • Must commit to a single semester full-time internship. The work term is August 2021- December 2021

Preferred Qualifications

  • Ability to perform research independently
  • Ability to prioritize tasks while working on multiple projects
  • Strong math skills and ability to learn complex engineering concepts
  • Experience in 1 or more programming languages (Example – C#, Python)
  • Ability to clearly communicate technical ideas to a non-technical audience

Hours per Week

40 hours per week

U.S. Citizenship Requirements

Due to our research contracts with the US federal government, candidates for this position are required to be US Citizens.

Clearance Type Required

Candidates must be able to obtain and maintain a Secret Clearance upon hire

Housing and Relocation

Housing and relocation assistance are not available for this position.

StoneX (formerly known as INTL FCStone) is an institutional-grade financial services network that connects companies, organizations and investors to the global markets ecosystem through a unique blend of digital platforms, end-to-end clearing and execution services, high-touch service and deep expertise. Help us grow into an ever-evolving marketplace. Seeking an eager Machine Learning Engineer Intern to help solve critical problems within our industry.

WHAT WE DO

Betterview is the only property data platform that informs every transaction for decision-makers who want to reduce risk, cost & waste in an increasingly competitive environment. We provide software and services that capture, organize, and analyze data for buildings and properties to unlock valuable insight. Our company is quickly becoming essential to every transaction by making every property thoroughly understood.

Every day, our team is focused on the needs of our customers. We strive to earn their trust by providing valuable, accurate insight that is important to their businesses. We provide our customers with information that is not only useful to their business decisions but is easy to use. We combine high quality human interactions with sleek, intuitive design and are pioneers on the journey alongside our customers, who are transforming the way they do business with data-driven decision-making.

THE OPPORTUNITY
Betterview is opening up exciting three-to-six-month-long internship opportunities on its machine learning team. We are looking for eager and enthusiastic people who are as passionate about solving tough problems as we are. As an intern, you will be able to participate in all parts of our process, from training computer vision models on aerial imagery to building out our machine learning infrastructure. Some of the critical problems we're solving are:

  • How can we keep improving our image classification and semantic segmentation models?
  • What additional value can we add by integrating other sources of information?
  • How can we better create and work with existing building footprints from aerial imagery?
  • How can we tell how well a property will interact with the upcoming storm season?
  • How will the property handle a brush fire in the near area?
  • How can we better determine the age of a roof?
  • How can we be more efficient about labeling and curating our training data?
  • How can we increase the speed and efficiency of predictions?

WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING

  • Training computer vision models to analyze buildings and properties, identify aspects of interest to insurance companies. You will work with datasets created and curated by the data science team.
  • Participating in efforts to expand and improve the existing machine learning code base. This includes adding to our dataset generation, training, and evaluation pipelines.
  • Identifying areas where Betterview should branch out and implement new machine learning systems and techniques
  • Exploring new techniques in computer vision. Follow the latest trends in computer vision and apply cutting-edge research to our challenges.
  • Evaluating classifiers and work with the data science team to promote the best models
  • Building and improving our code base

WHAT YOU WILL BRING TO OUR COMPANY


  • Experience training deep learning models for computer vision tasks
  • Knowledge of machine learning fundamentals, such as linear algebra, calculus, statistics, statistical learning, and pattern recognition
  • Understanding of machine learning design principles (e.g. training and validation, regularization, boosting, etc.)
  • Coding skills and good knowledge of computer science fundamentals (algorithms, data structures, time complexity)
  • Experience with and interest in working in Python
  • Experience with modern deep learning frameworks such as TensorFlow/Keras, PyTorch, or Jax
  • Experience with common data science tools, such as Jupyter Notebooks, numpy, pandas, scikit-learn
  • Interest in reading academic papers and trying to implement state-of-the-art experimental systems
  • Familiarity with modern deep learning architectures, such as ResNet, UNet, etc
  • Knowledge of imagery analysis techniques
  • Relevant degrees (especially advanced ones) are always a plus, but we know great machine learning engineers can come from all backgrounds.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Knowledge of data query and data processing tools (i.e. SQL).
  • Experience working with relational database tools such as PostgreSQL.
  • Experience working with cloud infrastructure (AWS, GCP, and Azure).
  • Experience with version control systems such as git/GitHub.
  • Publications in relevant conferences, such as CVPR, NeurIPS, ICCV, ICML, ICLR.
  • Experience with building footprint registration.
  • Experience with aerial imagery.
  • Experience writing production code.

WHAT WE PROVIDE

  • Hourly pay
  • Paid sick leave
  • Three to six months of valuable industry experience
  • Typical work schedule is Monday – Friday (8:30am-5pm)

At First American, interns receive real-world work experience and development opportunities to help further their career goals.

We are seeking a rising undergraduate entering their Junior or Senior year enrolled in an accredited college with a focus in Information Technology, Computer Engineering, Computer Science or related field.

The undergraduate track is open to any student currently enrolled in a college or university program.

In addition to the day-to-day responsibilities, undergraduate interns participate in professional development opportunities, panel workshops, as well as industry and organizational overviews.

You will have the opportunity to bridge the gap between academic understanding and practical professional experience to develop skills that will help set you up for success.

Interns also engage with senior leaders and executives in collaborative discussions aimed at providing professional insight and inspiration about First American as an employer of choice.

All interns are paid a competitive rate based on their specific track and have the flexibility to work from home in the event that local offices are not open.

Position Overview

The Information Security Vulnerability Remediation Management team is responsible for managing Vulnerability Items (VITs) across the organization.

The team is required to perform comprehensive vulnerability assessments in an effort to validate, triage, identify issues, and take action on VITs.

With collaboration from various units, the team helps to identify areas of improvement with integrations from multiple security platforms to the ServiceNow Vulnerability Remediation Module.

These tasks require the ability to learn and understand Information Security Policies and Standards.

Duties may include assisting the team with: documenting functionality, creating process flow diagrams, VIT assessment, VIT monitoring, scheduling meetings, taking meeting notes, creating or updating Knowledge Base articles, researching in vulnerability management tools, creating excel reports, analyzing issues, and testing enhancements.

This position works closely with IT groups outside of InfoSec and business units involved in VIT remediation.

Knowledge and Skills/Technology Used

Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Outlook, PowerPoint, Access, Excel, Visio)

Working in a fast-paced environment where priorities can change regularly, requiring the ability to adapt and adopt quickly

Ability to self-start and be versatile in a dynamic environment

Strong problem solving skills

Listens to others and accepts input from team members

An interest and willingness to learn

Interest in and basic awareness of Information Security and Cyber security

The ability to solve problems, be detailed oriented and be conscientious about all work completed

Excellent written and oral communication skills

Basic awareness of server and operating systems

Knowledge of Agile methodology basics

Ability to work from home

First American invests in its employees' development and well-being, empowers them to provide superior customer service and encourages them to serve the communities where they live and work. First American is committed to diversity and inclusion. We are an equal opportunity employer.

Based on eligibility, First American offers a comprehensive benefits package including medical, dental, vision, 401k, PTO/paid sick leave and other great benefits like an employee stock purchase plan.

At Stansberry Research, we thrive on new ideas and the entrepreneurial spirit. Naturally, we always look for new people, explorers, and innovators. If you are interested in a career where your ideas won't only be heard but rather celebrated, we'd like to hear from you.

Founded in 1999 and based in Baltimore, Maryland, Stansberry Research is the largest independent source of financial insight in the world. It delivers unbiased investment advice to self-directed investors seeking an edge in a wide variety of sectors and market conditions.

Stansberry Research has nearly two dozen analysts and researchers – including former hedge-fund managers and buy-side financial experts. They produce a steady stream of timely research on value investing, income generation, natural resources, biotech, financials, short-selling, macroeconomic analysis, options trading and more.

Waymo is an autonomous driving technology company with a mission to make it safe and easy for people and things to get where they’re going. Since our start as the Google Self-Driving Car Project in 2009, Waymo has been focused on building the World’s Most Experienced Driver in hopes of improving the world's access to mobility while saving thousands of lives now lost to traffic crashes. Our Waymo Driver powers Waymo One, our fully autonomous ride-hailing service, as well as Waymo Via, our trucking and local delivery service. To date, Waymo has driven over 20 million miles autonomously on public roads across 25 U.S. cities and conducted over 20 billion miles of simulation testing.

Waymo interns work alongside leaders in the industry on projects that deliver significantimpact to the company. We believe learning is a two-way street: leveraging your knowledge while providing you with opportunities to expand your skill-set. Interns are an important part of our culture and our recruiting pipeline. Join us at Waymo for a fun and rewarding internship!

position: Paid Internship - Embedded Software Engineer Intern
description:
About Intrepid Control Systems

Intrepid Control Systems focuses on providing high-quality computer software and hardware services and products for engineers in vehicle autonomy, connectivity, automotive Ethernet, and embedded engineering. Its customers include many of the global automakers and major tier one suppliers working on autonomous and connected vehicles.

Intrepid is a global provider of innovative tools for engineers in the vehicle networking, testing, and embedded engineering fields. Widely recognized for our neoVI, ValueCAN, and Vehicle Spy tools, we’ve also developed a new line of solutions for Automotive Ethernet devices for 1000BASE-T1 and 100BASE-T1/BroadR-Reach.

Proximity to customers has allowed Intrepid to provide excellent customer service. With offices in China, Japan, the United Kingdom, Germany, India, Japan, and Korea supplementing our US headquarters, Intrepid provides unparalleled support to its clients worldwide.

Internship Summary

The Embedded Software Intern will be able to work on the latest Automotive Technologies. The Intern in this position will be working on creating applications and demonstrations based on the Adaptive Autosar Platform and other automotive technology. The host development environment will be mostly Linux, and most of the targets will also be running embedded Linux.

If the intern in this position shows great promise they may get hired in our core Embedded Development with the Intrepid Core Engineering team.

  • Work with C & C++ applications and development on target boards
  • Other duties as assigned

  • C, C++, CMAKE
  • Yocto
  • Bitbake
  • OpenEmbedded
  • Linux
  • Embedded development using various targets, Gitlab, Networking technologies (TCP, UDP, IP, Sockets), and working Opensource stacks and libs
  • CAN/CAN FD, Automotive Ethernet

Qualifications

  • Bachelors or Masters in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or Electrical Engineering
  • Previous projects and Experience using the skills mentioned above is a plus
  • Debugging skills
  • Work independently
  • Being able to read, analyze, learn, test, and document
  • Being able to solve problems
  • Very well organized
  • Be able to think critically

POSITION SUMMARY

The IT Specialist Intern will support IT assets by testing, assessing viability for everyday business/productivity use and helping with the on-boarding and off-boarding of employees assigned assets. Will assist in setup and troubleshooting of all employees assigned assets and give recommendations if repairs or replacements are required. Will work with iOS, Windows OS and Android OS devices. Will oversee the IT asset inventory management software and any helpdesk tickets. Will document calls/ticket issue resolutions for each designated helpdesk ticket. Will work under the direct supervision of the Help Desk Manager.

EXAMPLES OF WORK

· Assists callers with requests for information technology services, repair or support requests, complaints, and inquiries and direct to appropriate IT personnel via computer tracking system.

· Updates records and documents information pertaining to it asset inventory.

· Supports common business and productivity software.

· Installs and configures computer systems and applications within the company.

· Assists management in creating training materials pertaining to computer troubleshooting and usage.

Passion for assisting others and command of troubleshooting techniques. Able to translate technical concepts into layman’s terms. Capable of working independently and with little oversight. Excellent written and verbal communication skills, particularly on the phone. Works well under pressure and meets tight deadlines. Highly computer literate with capability in email, MS Office, Excel and related business and communication tools. Ability to type 60+wpm a plus. Fantastic organizational and time management skills. NVIDIA's invention of the GPU in 1999 sparked the growth of the PC gaming market, redefined modern computer graphics, and revolutionized parallel computing. More recently, GPU deep learning ignited modern AI — the next era of computing — with the GPU acting as the brain of computers, robots, and self-driving cars that can perceive and understand the world. Today, we are increasingly known as “the AI computing company.” We're looking to grow our company, and build our teams with the smartest people in the world. Join us at the forefront of technological advancement.

NVIDIA is seeking an intern for the discovery and development of Deep Learning solutions for autonomous machines including robotics and real-time embedded applications. The individual will be responsible for the development and deployment of innovative AI IoT edge applications in the field of Computer Vision or natural language processing (NLP) on Jetson products. You will have chance to build your own innovative AI application from scratch which can start from gathering datasets, crafting data (sensor) pipeline, and building and deploying deep learning models.

What you’ll be doing:

  • Brainstorm ideas for computer vision and NLP applications on NVIDIA Jetson

  • Develop and experiment with deep learning models which can fit on embedded systems

  • Performance analysis and optimization using NVIDIA’s tools such as TensorRT

  • Build and deploy deep learning models on wheeled robots, robotic arms, etc.

What we need to see:

  • You are pursuing a PhD, MS, or BS in Computer Science or related field or equivalent experience

  • Proven experience working with at least one of the deep learning frameworks and programming languages such as Python, C++

  • Previous ROS background and PyTorch experience is a plus

  • Self-driven, motivated and enthusiastic to work on state-of-art machine learning tools

Ways to stand out from the crowd:

  • Strong self-initiative, interpersonal skills, and resourcefulness with new technology

  • Excellent problem solving and partnership

NVIDIA is committed to fostering a diverse work environment and proud to be an equal opportunity employer. As we highly value diversity in our current and future employees, we do not discriminate (including in our hiring and promotion practices) on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender expression , sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or any other characteristic protected by law.

We’re looking for a Systems Engineering Intern (July/August – Dec 2021) to join our North American Systems and Services team in Burlington, MA.

Working for Signify means being creative and adaptive. Our culture of continuous learning and commitment to diversity and inclusion creates an environment that allows you to build your skills and career. Together, we’re transforming our industry.

As the world leader in lighting, we’re constantly ahead of the curve. Through our leadership in connected lighting and the Internet of Things, we’re breaking new grounds in data analytics, AI, and smart homes, offices, cities and more!

Signify is one of the few companies in the world to achieve carbon neutrality and our next sustainability goals are even bolder: doubling our positive impact on the environment and society by 2025.

As a Systems Engineering Intern, you’ll be responsible for participating in customer projects through all phases from design to proposal through completion.

We’re on the lookout for forward-thinking innovators with a passion for sustainability. If you match this description, get in touch!

What you’ll do

  • Develop internal tools, procedures, and ways of working with Systems Engineers for use on customer projects
  • Build mock-ups and test bench setups to test and support various Signify control system architectures (once we are back in the Burlington office)
  • Review/verify system designs, specifications, and drawings for various lighting control system applications and develop project configuration files accordingly
  • Accompany Systems Engineers to perform system start-ups at customer locations with the potential to self-perform start-ups

Your qualifications

  • Currently enrolled at an accredited college or university pursuing a Bachelors’ Degree in Electrical Engineering or similar technical discipline (Electrical/Lighting Controls, Industrial or Building Automation, Computer Science or related specialty)
  • Knowledge of Electrical Controls and Automation, Programming, Networking preferred
  • Knowledge of lighting technologies and a technical understanding of lighting controls is a plus
  • Ability to interpret architectural/electrical drawings; CAD skills are a plus
  • Ability to demonstrate excellent organization and communication skills
  • Excellent technical troubleshooting skills

Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without current or future company sponsorship needs.

What you’ll get in return…

This internship/co-op could lead to an at-will full time role. We’re offering multiple opportunities for career development, like mentoring, coaching and stretch assignments, with strong international exposure for dynamic profiles. Learning is fundamental to our culture. Through continuous learning, we are transforming the industry. You have the chance to learn every day, acquire new skills and perspectives through customized online programs, and on-the-job experiences.

See #SignifyLife through the eyes of our employees!

Who we are

Signify is the world leader in lighting. We provide professional customers and consumers with quality, energy-efficient LED lighting. And our lights, when connected, bring data to devices, apps and people – redefining what light can do and how you use it. Today, our innovations, such as LiFi – internet connectivity through light – and UV-C, solar and horticultural lighting, contribute to a safer, smarter, more sustainable world.

We’re operating in 74 countries with 32,000 people worldwide.

Who are we?

Enchanted Rock is a leader and innovator in distributed energy. Enchanted Rock has responded to long-term trends in electricity by becoming the first smart-grid supplier to US energy consumers. The company installs, operates, and integrates its highly flexible, low-cost, and quick-response distributed generation to increase reliability and stability, reduce cost and decrease carbon footprint.


At Enchanted Rock, our backup generators ensure that customers will never be without power, allowing their business to operate normally when there is an outage in the area. Our innovative approach provides customers with highly reliable, ultra-clean backup generation at a fraction of the cost of traditional backup solutions. We seek those who share our commitment to customer service, innovation, and ingenuity.


We are actively recruiting candidates to participate in our 2021 Summer Internship program. This program is roughly 12 weeks in length and will immerse you into the culture and operations of Enchanted Rock.


Position Overview

We are looking to hire a resourceful, enthusiastic individual to assume the role of Structuring Analyst Intern. The Structuring Analyst Intern will aid in pricing new customer service contracts. This role will generally entail financial modeling, market analysis, customer data analysis, and creating proposal for prospective clients. The Structuring Analyst’s Intern role requires close collaboration with various departments, including finance, sales, business operations, and engineering.

Internship Highlights

  • Fun, open, and transparent office environment located in downtown H-Town!
  • Enhanced learning through hands-on work experience.
  • Mentoring and career advice from knowledgeable and experienced professionals in the Technology/Energy industries.
  • Develop project management, time management, and communication skills.
  • Working in a collaborative culture that supports ongoing growth and learning.


Where You Come In

  • Assist with price and costing models.
  • Assist the Structuring and Pricing team in coordinating with Sales to ensure necessary customer specific information is obtained to enable customer pricing and proposals and confirm proposals are compliant with appropriate required returns.
  • Assist in the analysis of customer electrical usage data.
  • Assist the Structuring and Pricing team in coordinating with the Operations team to analyze power markets to ensure service prices are set competitively.
  • Assist the Structuring and Pricing team in coordinating with Operations team to calculate operational cost inputs.
  • Assist with the analysis of competitors and competitive pricing.
  • Assist in the maintenance of the pricing database.
  • Assist with the development, communication, and promotion of all documentation related to the pricing structure.
  • Assist with the organization and preparation of responses to requests for proposals.
  • Assist in creating and maintaining a prospective proposal pipeline database.
  • Additional responsibilities may be added at the direction of Company’s management.

What it Takes to Succeed

  • 2-3 years undergraduate experience working toward a bachelor’s degree in a quantitative discipline (e.g. Business, Economics, Accounting, Mathematics, or Computer Science).
  • The successful candidate will be a highly motivated individual with excellent organizational skills and a basic understanding of financial models.
  • Candidates should be detail-oriented, can efficiently multi-task, and the ability to work and succeed in a high degree of uncertainty and complex interactions.
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills.
  • Ability to think analytically, present ideas professionally, and work in project teams.
  • Excellent computer skills and proficiency with MS Office products (Outlook, Word, Excel & Power Point).

POSTION: Evaluation Intern
DEPARTMENT: External Relations
LOCATION: Brooklyn Park HQ/Remote
SUPERVISED BY: Manager of Applied Research and Policy

JOB DESCRIPTION
This position will assist the Manager of Applied Research and Policy in the development of a foundation for applied research and evaluation activities at Second Harvest Heartland (SHH). The primary role of the Evaluation Intern will be to support the creation and facilitation of an interdepartmental Guiding Coalition.

The purpose of the Guiding Coalition is to participate in the development of a framework for evaluation, research, and learning at Second Harvest. A critical part of the framework will be the collaborative creation of a Theory of Change representing the wide variety of services provided by SHH and the methods by which we aim to end hunger in our community, as well as our plan to measure our progress towards that goal. Intentionally addressed during this process will be food insecurity discrepancies among people of different races and ethnicities.

The Theory of Change framework will be used to identify the areas of greatest research and evaluation need and current capacity. Based on this framework we aim to make inform decisions about how to improve services, both within SHH and with other hunger-relief partners in the agency network, particularly aimed at decreasing disparities based on race and ethnicity. The Guiding Coalition will be comprised of SHH staff from across departments and will represent all levels of responsibility to ensure a wide range of perspectives.

DUTIES/DELIVERABLES
The Evaluation Intern will play a key role in the development and execution of the processes used to facilitate the Guiding Coalition in the development of a framework for evaluation, research, and learning at SHH. Duties will include:
  • Support recruitment of staff members to participate in the Guiding Coalition
  • Support the design of facilitation processes used for Guiding Coalition meetings
  • Take part in facilitating Guiding Coalition meetings using web-based tools to enable interactive participation in virtual meetings by all members
  • Communicate with Guiding Coalition members about the process including meeting reminders, follow ups, and scheduling
  • Conduct a literature review to provide guidance for members to determine the best way to define and measure SHH’s progress towards meeting our mission of “ending hunger together.”
  • Support the development of a research & evaluation 101 training

MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS:
  • A combination of education and experience generally attained through a bachelor’s degree in a related field(s): data science, program evaluation, epidemiological research, public health, or similar field
  • Previous successful completion of coursework or experience conducting program evaluation is highly desired
  • Experience with group facilitation and/or Theory of Change or Logic Model development is desired
  • Knowledge and/or experience searching for and reviewing scholarly articles
  • Demonstrated ability to effectively communicate with supervisor and colleagues and to support group processes
  • Ability to work remotely including reasonable work accommodations. Some in-person work may occur depending on Covid restrictions and SHH’s back to work plan but will be discussed with interns to determine feasibility and comfort level
  • Demonstrated familiarity with Microsoft Office, Office 365, video conferencing programs (e.g., Zoom, Microsoft Teams) and the ability to learn other computer software programs
  • Ability to work with flexibility, efficiency, and enthusiasm, both individually and as part of a team in a fast-paced, high-demand environment
  • Demonstrated ability to be self-motivated in planning and follow through on multiple daily tasks and projects

TIME REQUIREMENTS AND SCHEUDLE:
  • Total time requirement: end of May – early September 2021; 10-20 hours per week. The full process of the Guiding Coalition may not be completed within the summer. There is an opportunity for candidate to continue with the project during Fall 2021, based on mutual interest, funding, and candidate’s skills relevant to the next stage of work
  • Days of the week: Days and times of the week for this position are flexible, especially for work done independently.
  • Time of the day: Candidates must be available at least once or twice a week during normal office hours (Monday- Friday 8am to 4:30pm) to meet with the position supervisor and for Guiding Coalition meetings.
  • Work sites: Second Harvest Heartland HQ Brooklyn Park, as well as remote

PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT/LEARNING OBJECTIVES:
Learning objectives can be jointly developed between the chosen candidate and the Manager of Applied Research and Policy. Several possible learning objectives that fit within this project include:
  • Plan engagement and how to use feedback from individuals working in a variety of settings to address hunger
  • Conduct a literature review to identify ways to measure hunger and food insecurity and progress on reducing these experiences among community members
  • Develop theory of change or logic model depicting interventions to address hunger and food insecurity based on the collaborative Guiding Coalition process
  • Perform effectively on inter-professional teams
  • Critically assess how structural bias and racism impact food insecurity and how SHH can intentionally address these inequities in our work
  • Apply systems thinking tools to a public health issue
  • Apply negotiation and mediation skills to address organizational or community challenges


Second Harvest Heartland is an EEO/AA Employer

How to Apply


Description

The U.S. Combat Capabilities Development Command, Chemical Biological Center (DEVCOM CBC) is offering an internship at the Rock Island, Illinois facility.

What will I be doing?

As an ORISE participant, you will join a community of scientists and researchers in an effort to apply knowledge, skill, and ability (KSA) in developing web-based information system solutions, in accordance with the Department of Defense (DoD) Risk Management Framework for the Joint Acquisition Chem-Bio Knowledge System (JACKS) project. DEVCOM CBC will provide hands-on experience allowing you to enhance your skills in Microsoft .Net Framework, and .Net Core using the C# programming language, JavaScript, and various UI frameworks such as Bootstrap, and JQuery.

Why should I apply?

Under the guidance of a mentor, you will gain hands-on experience, attend specialized classes and technical seminars to complement your education and support your academic and professional goals. During your appointment you will learn how to apply the KSA for developing software in the DoD environment and develop data auditing routines that adhere to the the Security Technical Implementation Guide (STIG) for Application Software. In addition, your mentor will develop personal learning objectives in accordance to your professional goals.

Additional learning objectives will include:

  • Apply communication skills to understand requirements, use cases, and propose new and innovative solutions to business analysts, and software development team leaders.
  • Experience unit testing in a Microsoft development environment and have the opportunity to propose improvements to software code unit testing.
  • Acquire skills developing information system user role functions, data integrity, and application availability monitoring and reporting.
  • Analyze, evaluate, and provide briefings on new technology proposals, trends, and concepts with emphasis on cybersecurity and system improvements

Where will I be located? Rock Island, Illinois

What is the anticipated start date?

The DEVCOM Chemical Biological Center is ready to make appointments immediately. Exact start dates will be determined at the time of selection and in coordination with the selected candidate. Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis and internships will be filled as qualified candidates are identified.

Appointment Length

This appointment is a twelve month, part-time research appointment, with the possibility to be renewed for additional research periods. Appointments may be extended depending on funding availability, project assignment, program rules, and availability of the participant.

What are the benefits?

You will receive a stipend to be determined by DEVCOM Chemical Biological Center. Stipends are typically based on a participant’s academic standing, discipline, experience, and research facility location. Other benefits may include the following:

  • Health Insurance Supplement. Participants are eligible to purchase health insurance through ORISE.
  • Relocation Allowance
  • Training and Travel Allowance

Nature of Appointment

You will not enter into an employee/employer relationship with ORISE, ORAU, DoD, or any other office or agency. Instead, you will be affiliated with ORISE for the administration of the appointment through the ORISE appointment letter and Terms of Appointment.

About DEVCOM Chemical Biological Center

The DEVCOM Chemical Biological Center is the primary Department of Defense technical organization for non-medical chemical and biological defense. DEVCOM Chemical Biological Center possesses an unrivaled chemical biological research and development infrastructure with scientists, engineers, technician, and specialists located at four different sites in the United States. DEVCOM Chemical Biological Center has a unique role in technology development that cannot be duplicated by private industry or research universities. It fosters research, development, testing, and application of technologies for protecting Warfighters, first responders, and the nation from chemical and biological warfare agents. For more information about the DEVCOM Chemical Biological Center, please visit https://www.cbc.ccdc.army.mil/.

Qualifications

Candidates should be actively pursuing a bachelor's, master's, or doctoral degree with the intent to graduate between May 2021 - May 2024 in one of the following areas: Computer Information System, Computer Science, Software Engineering, or related information technology degree. Associate degree candidates will also be considered. Please note: undergraduate students must be Registar Office documented sophomores, juniors and seniors.

  • Ability to obtain and maintain a SECRET clearance is required. While participants will not enter into an employment relationship with DoD or any other agency, this opportunity will require a suitability investigation/background investigation. Any offer made is considered tentative pending favorable outcome of the investigation.
  • Currently have, or obtain within 6 months from starting the opportunity with the government, one of the following DoD 8570.01-M IAT Level I Certifications: A+ CE - CCNA-Security - CND - Network+ CE - SSCP
  • Complete a computing environment course such as a Microsoft Developer course within 6 months from starting the opportunity.

A complete application consists of:

  • Zintellect Profile
  • Educational and Employment History
  • Essay Questions (goals, experiences, and skills relevant to the opportunity)
  • Resume (PDF)
  • Transcripts/Academic Records - For this opportunity, an unofficial transcript or copy of the student academic records printed by the applicant or by academic advisors from internal institution systems may be submitted.
  • One Recommendation

Submitted documents must have all social security numbers, student identification numbers, and/or dates of birth removed (blanked out, blackened out, made illegible, etc.) prior to uploading into the application system. All documents must be in English or include an official English translation.

JOB Title: Agronomy and Farm Solutions Intern

Job Summary

The Agronomy and Farm Solutions team at AGCO is driven to enhance farm value through science and engineering by connecting sensors and machines to plants and soils to more effectively manage genetics, crop protection products, fertilizers, and other machine-centric farm operations thereby increasing yield and reducing waste. The primary focus of this internship opportunity is to assist the North American agronomy team execute field research trials. The successful candidate will support research trials that are a part of the development process of new equipment to ensure agronomic challenges are identified and with trials that evaluate customer ROI and best management practices using existing equipment products. The intern will gain valuable experience in, but limited to, new planter technology, soil compaction and management, best sprayer practices, and nutrient management. Focus product lines include Crop Care - seeding, tillage, and application equipment. Although the position may at times require additional travel, most work will be spent in the upper Midwest. The ideal candidate would be based remotely in the eastern South Dakota region in order to frequently visit research trials in neighboring states. However, consideration will also be given to exceptional candidates who may live outside of the defined region.


Job Function and Responsibilities

  • Support with establishing field trials across the Midwest that will include supporting field product specialists and dealers with plot planting and execution
  • Evaluate field trials and collect in-season agronomic data multiple times throughout the season in order to explain the equipment’s impact on crop growth and development
  • Analyze agronomic data and present findings
  • Participate in Agronomy related field days
  • Additional responsibilities include developing agronomic content for educational material to be used within AGCO related to nutrient management, integrated pest management, and soil management

FUNCTIONAL KNOWLEDGE


  • Self-motivated, innovative, problem-solving, and solutions-oriented mindset
  • General knowledge of corn, soybean, and general crop growth and development
  • Candidate should be proficient in the use of a personal computer (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, etc.)
  • Ability to work in the heat or cold outside and able to walk and work unassisted in fields
  • Ability to work extended hours during peak busy seasons and overnight travel


ESSENTIAL SKILLS:
QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE

  • Pursuing a bachelor’s degree in Agronomy, Crop Science, Precision Agriculture or some other related field
  • Minimum GPA requirement of 3.0
  • Current junior or senior standing at an accredited university
  • Satisfactory level of technical knowledge in agronomy, Ag technology, and crop sciences preferred
  • Working knowledge of modern farm equipment, especially planters, tillage tools, and sprayers

Digital Diagnostics is looking for an AI/ML Summer Intern to advance our diagnostic products and algorithm development capabilities.


About Digital Diagnostics:

At Digital Diagnostics, we’re on a mission to transform the quality, accessibility, and affordability of global healthcare through the automation of medical diagnosis and treatment.

Our flagship product – IDx-DR – is an artificial intelligence algorithm where the computer, not the physician, performs the diagnosis. Built on a series of patented machine learning algorithms, our FDA cleared software platform detects early signs of diabetic retinopathy, a debilitating eye disease that impacts 30+ million people with diabetes in the US.

We are using everything we’ve learned from IDx-DR to expand our AI platform across different therapeutic areas like skin cancer. To deliver on our mission, we need to expand our team of highly skilled and motivated team members to help us change healthcare for the better!

  • Work with world-renowned computer scientists and clinicians to create AI diagnostics that can improve the quality and accessibility of healthcare for millions of people.

  • Get a front-row seat in what it takes to be the market leader in FDA-cleared AI diagnostics.

Who You Are:

If you’re someone who:

  • Enjoys applying your AI/ML skills to new and challenging problems
  • Works well independently but likes to brainstorm with and bounce ideas off of collaborators
  • Wants a peek behind the scenes of AI/ML development at a leading digital health company

Then apply to be our next AI/ML Summer Intern!

At DXS AI/ML interns work closely with the machine learning and AI team to prototype new algorithms for incorporation into our existing products and translate the latest machine learning research for application with real world medical data onto concrete applications.

Support VCU’s Information Security program by performing intrusion detection and incident response duties. Excellent interpersonal skills, including the ability to communicate technical concepts to non-technical audiences.

Technical experience working with the development and operations in system architecture, networking, and/or application development preferred.

Technical experience working with intrusion detection/prevention systems, security information event management systems, and general understanding of intrusion detection and incident response processes preferred.

WHO WE ARE:
We think too much marketing isn't us. It's mass markets not audiences of one. Homogenous groups to be targeted, not individuals to be inspired. Segments to reach, not people with their own ideas and ambitions. It's one size fits all and it's dull.

When it comes to individuals, we're fierce. We stand up for individuality. We speak up against bland, broad-brush generalizations. We fight for solutions that adapt to the individual's needs, beliefs, behaviors and aspirations. And we commit to doing this in every aspect of our work for clients and their consumers.

We actively foster an inclusive workplace where diversity and individual difference are valued and leveraged to achieve the agency's vision. And most importantly we value every individual's wellbeing.

We are Fiercely Individual.
As a guiding ethos, RAPP stands up for Individuality. So much so, that it's in our agency value proposition. We're committed to racial justice, equality, representation and unbiased economic opportunity, because we know that the strength of our diversity helps us create our best work. And we believe in harnessing the strength of all our Fiercely Individual people, and the differences among us, because that's the surest way to positively impact our business and network culture.

HOW WE DO IT:
At RAPP, we are fiercely focused on the individual and how we can create value from every individual's experience with a brand. We do this across three capability areas: customer centric consulting, creativity that inspires action, and customer experience management.

Our data analysts know who that person is. Our strategists understand what they want. And our award-winning Technologists and Creatives know how to get it to them.

RAPP is an integral part of Omnicom's Precision Marketing Group, comprising 4,000 creatives, technologists, strategists, and data and marketing scientists across 40 global markets.

THE INTERNSHIP:
In this 10-week program, our interns will work on client business (roughly 75% of time) and participate in an open-brief creative project (roughly 25% of time). Interns will support teams on the day-to-day client business (varied by department). Additionally, they will develop a collaborative creative project centered on a real-world problem. Each team will receive the appropriate resources, including mentors, to accomplish their goal and complete assignments. Our interns are sharp, and can think both strategically and creatively no matter what discipline they're assigned to.

We are in the business of relationships. We are problem solvers who work to identify opportunities and hone in on solutions that enhance and grow our client's business.

Design, develop, deploy and integrate complex back-end solutions (including Python, NodeJS, and C#) as well as front-end solutions (including ReactJS) to solve business or problems.

Develop unit-tests and non-regressions tests to accelerate your release frequency while ensuring high software quality.

Integrate with other applications and micro-services using REST interfaces, and enabling high automation in our delivery processes

Research and investigate technology solutions that could help resolve operational or business challenges, and demonstrate their efficiency by putting together proof of concepts and sharing these with the team

Be willing to learn and take direction and constructive criticism.

Be ready to give supportive arguments and voice your opinion.

Be proactive, ready to take initiative and able to lead other team members.

Open Power means opening energy access to more people; opening the world of energy to new technologies; opening new ways for people to manage energy; opening new uses of energy; and opening more partnerships. These are ambitious goals and we are pursuing them with the passion of more than 65,000 people whose brilliant work is based on our values of Responsibility, Innovation, Trust and Proactivity. At Enel North America, our businesses are leading the energy transition, creating the sustainable energy solutions of the future to help individuals, businesses and communities change energy into lasting value. Meet Enel X:: Enel X, part of Enel Group, is a global business leading the transformation of the energy sector. We enable consumers, businesses and communities to make smarter decisions about the way energy is created, stored and managed. We are passionate, motivated thinkers who are unified by our mission to change the way the world uses energy. We thrive on solving big problems for our customers and are fueled by our innovation and determination. In the US & Canada, Enel X combines the spirit of a startup with the expertise and infrastructure of a global innovator. We’re opening up the full spectrum of energy innovation to help our customers grow through sustainable energy solutions in the following core areas: Demand Response, Demand Management, Energy Supply Management, Energy Storage and Microgrids, Energy Efficiency, Electric Vehicle Charging, Utility Bill Management, and Sustainability. Together, with our passionate people, we are accelerating the pace of change in the energy industry, towards a more efficient and sustainable world. The Opportunity::
Enel X, a leading provider of Demand Response and Battery Storage Systems, has an immediate need for an Application Support Intern to join our world-class Global Operations team.

This is a highly visible role where you will utilize your troubleshooting and communications skills to provide technical support to internal staff for the applications we develop in-house. You will work closely with our application support analysts as well as our software engineers to investigate problems in our software and resolve them in a timely manner. You will work out of a ticketing system for managing incoming requests, and will run SQL queries, API queries review Splunk logs and other low-level techniques to determine root cause for application issues.

This is a six (6) month internship program from July 2021 through December 2021. Applicants must be willing to commit to a 40 hour work week schedule while employed.

  • Create good documentation on the resolutions to the issues you solve
  • Learn new systems and tools as they are developed and released by our Engineering teams

  • Desire to learn new technologies.

Research Internships at Microsoft provide a dynamic environment for research careers with a network of world-class research labs led by globally-recognized scientists and engineers. Our researchers and engineers pursue innovation in a range of scientific and technical disciplines to help solve complex challenges in diverse fields, including computing, healthcare, economics, and the environment.

The Brain-Computer Interfaces (BCI) project in Microsoft Research aims to enable BCI for the general population. This means non-intrusive methods, fewer number of electrodes and custom-designed signal picking devices. We go towards interactive BCI, which means response times within seconds and using EEG signals. In the BCI project are involved researcher from several research groups in Microsoft Research, you can find more about the project at https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/research/project/brain-computer-interfaces/.

Responsibilities

Interns put inquiry and theory into practice. Alongside fellow doctoral candidates and some of the world’s best researchers, interns learn, collaborate, and network for life. Interns not only advance their own careers, but they also contribute to exciting research and development strides. During the 12-week internship, students are paired with mentors and expected to collaborate with other interns and researchers, present findings, and contribute to the vibrant life of the community. Research internships are available in all areas of research, and are offered year-round, though they typically begin in the summer.

The summer interns in MSR BCI will work on well framed projects that allow for open exploration and collaboration, under the guidance of their mentors. The internship ends with a final presentation open to all Microsoft employees, and ideally results in a peer-reviewed scientific publication.

Qualifications

In addition to the qualifications below, you’ll need to submit a minimum of two reference letters for this position. After you submit your application, a request for letters may be sent to your list of references on your behalf. Note that reference letters cannot be requested until after you have submitted your application, and furthermore, that they might not be automatically requested for all candidates. You may wish to alert your letter writers in advance, so they will be ready to submit your letter.


Required Qualifications

  • Must be currently enrolled in a PhD program in Computer Science or a related STEM field.
  • Must have one year of experience with brain-computer interfaces and signal processing of EEG, or other biological signals.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Good publication record
  • Experience with machine learning for signal processing for EEG, bio signals and related sensor data is strongly preferred.
  • Experience applying algorithms within practical systems is a big plus.
  • Hands-on design and system implementation skills, including real-time data processing.
  • Strong coding skills preferred in MATLAB, Python or C/C++.

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. Are you eager to use your growing cyber skills to shift the future? Do you want to learn how to solve technical problems while collaborating with other students and industry experts? We’re looking for talented people like you to join our exclusive summer Cyber Internship program.

User Research Intern (Summer 2021)
About Brave
Brave is on a mission to save privacy on the web. We’ve built a free web browser that blocks creepy
ads and trackers right out of the box. As an alternative to invasive digital ad-tech surveillance, we’ve
pioneered completely private ads (opt-in!) that directly reward you for your attention. Brave has over
25 million monthly active users.

In more normal times, our roughly 100-person team orbits a “main” office of about 30 in San
Francisco, with smaller clusters spread around the world. Our work style combines an in-person
culture in the S.F. office with remote-inclusive practices emphasizing live conversations by video call
and fast and slow chat on Slack. This has made for a painless transition to fully remote work.

About the Role

Brave is looking for a User Research Intern, preferably located within 3 or less time zones from San
Francisco, to be part of our design team this summer 2021. Over the course of this 8-week paid
internship, you’ll be exposed to the full product design and development process at a fast-paced
startup. You’ll conduct user research on a variety of projects, develop a deep understanding of our
users, and influence the direction of product development. Guidance is embedded into the
internship, but you will also be expected to identify research opportunities and be self-motivated to
execute and operate independently as our user researcher. The ideal candidate already possesses
what it takes to fill an entry-level User Researcher role.

Pay: This is a paid internship. You will be paid an hourly rate of $25/hour.
Program length: June 15, 2021 – August 15, 2021 (8 weeks)
Location: Fully remote

Responsibilities

  • Perform tasks in the complete user research cycle, including requirements gathering,
structuring studies, recruiting participants, executing, analyzing data, forming product
recommendations, and distributing findings
  • Collaborate with product, design, and marketing to identify research areas and
develop hypotheses
  • Discern the best UX research technique to use in the face of time and value
constraints in a startup environment
  • Independently run research projects on several product design topics
  • Uncover areas of opportunity and follow-up with actionable recommendations backed
by evidence
  • Communicate research findings, recommendations and rationale to the design and
product team, marketing, engineers, and the company at large
  • Craft and execute research plans with a mix of qualitative and quantitative
methodologies
  • Help set up and manage a pipeline of preferred users we involve continuously in
research
  • Contribute to best practices for a lean research function at Brave
  • Coordinate research training initiatives for the design team
  • Increase user empathy across the organization
  • Participate in and contribute to design critiques

Required Skills and Experience

  • Pursuing an advanced degree in Human-Computer Interaction, Human Factors,
Cognitive Psychology, Cognitive Science, or related program (or
equivalent/demonstrable work experience)
  • A portfolio showcasing past user research work and deliverables
  • Experience with recruiting coordination, conducting user research, and remote
studies
  • Deep knowledge of UX research techniques, including the strengths and limitations
of each
  • Comfortable structuring user research around shifting priorities
  • A collaborative and empathic approach to partnering with design, product, and
engineering teams and influencing product direction
  • A deep curiosity about people and their underlying motivations
  • Understanding of the latest UX best practices
  • Able to explain complex topics clearly and simply for different audiences
  • Excellent communication (verbal and written) skills
  • Strong observational and analytical skills
  • Able to give and receive structured feedback

Nice-to-Have

  • Experience with Userlytics
  • User research in international markets
  • Experience using Figma (our primary tool)
  • Basic prototyping skills using Figma, Keynote or other tools
  • Interest in the privacy & security space
  • Enthusiasm for Brave’s mission

position: Paid Summer Intern - Graduate, Product & Experience Team, User Research
description:
JOB DESCRIPTION

This summer you could have the opportunity to help drive the brand vision for Levi’s! Our San Francisco-based Summer Internship opportunities give students real world work experience and exposure to one of the world’s leading fashion and apparel companies. Our 10 week Summer Internship Program is the perfect way to gain work experience within the core of the organization, while learning what a career at LS&Co. might have in store for you.

The DTC Product & Experience team at Levi Strauss & Co. values learning from our customers by understanding their motivations, behaviors and emotions so that we can effectively build frictionless shopping experiences. We are looking for an empathetic and curious UX Research Intern to help us gather insights that will push our experiences to the next level.

As a UX Research Intern, you will join a small research team and have the opportunity to lead one or more research projects while being mentored throughout the summer. During your internship, you will collaborate with other researchers, product managers, UX designers, and other business partners on projects that will influence product strategy and have direct customer impact. You’ll experience how a fast-paced product organization works, create research studies based on consumer problems or business opportunities, and have many opportunities to develop your research skills.

As a UX Research Intern , you will:

  • Collaborate closely with other researchers, with product managers and designers to drive user research for features at various stages of the product cycle.
  • Design and conduct research studies for new and existing features by understanding the problem, defining hypotheses, and using the best research methods.
  • Analyze and synthesize research findings into actionable insights and opportunities.
  • Share research methods and tools that enable product teams to conduct their own research.
  • Clearly communicate research findings to a variety of stakeholders.

You'll be a great addition to the team if:

  • You are curious, empathetic, enjoy inspiring others by bringing user stories to life, and have a strong bias towards action.
  • You have a strong understanding of different qualitative and quantitative user research methods and know when and how to apply them.
  • You are willing and able to contribute to every aspect of the research cycle, including research operations (recruitment, scheduling, moderation, notetaking, synthesis/ analysis, etc.).
  • You are able to present a research portfolio that showcases your approach to conducting research and synthesizing insights.
  • You are excited to learn and grow as a researcher.

Requirements for the Internship:

  • Bachelor’s Degree
  • Currently enrolled full-time in a Masters program with an anticipated graduation date of 2022
  • High proficiency in PowerPoint and Excel
  • A background in Human Computer Interaction, Human Factors, Cognitive Science, Psychology, Sociology or a related field

Additional Qualifications:

  • Project management and analytical skills
  • Ability to understand, integrate and synthesize primary and secondary data to form insightful observations and clear, actionable brand and business implications
  • Flexibility and the ability to adapt to meet new requirements and a dynamic job environment

EOE M/F/Disability/Vets

LOCATION

San Francisco, CA, USA

FULL TIME/PART TIME

Full time

Current LS&Co Employees, apply via your Workday account.

Job Description

Position Summary

We are looking for a Lab Technician with the desire to participate in hands-on learning in the wine industry during Harvest 2021. Validate compliance to product specifications and adherence to GMP’s through routine and advanced chemical analyses on juices, wines, Spirits, and other Company products. Communicate with and provide feedback to production team members to facilitate process improvement. This position follows standard work methods and practices safe work habits to ensure production is as efficient and safe as possible.

This is a temporary assignment, generally between August through November. Schedules are determined on an as needed basis to keep up with grape processing. This may include weekend work, and overtime.

Responsibilities:

  • Learn and follow all laboratory work instructions and safety procedures.
  • Standardize equipment as needed and ensure it is working properly.
  • Perform accurate routine and advanced chemical and physical analysis on wines, juices, concentrates and other company products.
  • Collect samples from tanks and barrels, prepare samples for analysis.
  • Prepare reagents and standard solutions.
  • Prepare, maintain, and distribute required reports and records.
  • Contribute to producing quality products by completing assignments in a safe, efficient and valuable manner.
  • Maintain lab cleanliness and a safe, sanitary working environment.
  • Compliance with all Company policies and procedures.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Ability to work from June through the end of November.
  • Ability to work various shifts including weekends and overtime
  • Recent graduate or pursuing a degree in Food Science, Chemistry or related field
  • Strong knowledge of analytical procedures.
  • Strong knowledge of mathematics.
  • Strong attention to detail and ability to precisely follow directions.
  • Experience in computer applications (Excel, Word, and Outlook).
  • Must be 21 years of age.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Previous lab experience
  • Knowledge of various wine types
  • Ability to handle multiple tasks.
  • Strong interpersonal skills.
  • Experience with MS Teams and Sharepoint

Working Conditions/Physical Requirements:

Working conditions in certain areas of the winery are cold, warm, wet, slippery and noisy. Involves exposure to loud noises, fumes, toxic chemicals, near moving mechanical parts and lift truck traffic. Frequent walking, standing, sitting, stooping, kneeling, crouch or crawl, going up and down stairs and ladders. Must be able to move up to 55 lbs. Must have a valid driver’s license. Occasional travel with ability to work weekends and overtime. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Job Description


We are looking for an energetic intern who has a passion for technology and working with gaming and media applications across multiple platforms. In this internship you will work with a dynamic team that pulls together compelling demos that showcase the features of Intel's latest platforms. We create new usages and experiences and show Intel's competitive advantage on PC's and mobile devices.

We collaborate with marketing, engineering, sales and development groups to make sure we have the best examples of software that makes hardware shine - and our work directly affects the sales of Intel client platforms. Once we have created these experiences, we collaborate with different parts of the company and we participate in trade shows to evangelize them. In this internship you will gain expertise in the client software ecosystem and how to develop marketing and sales collateral to support the platform value proposition.

The internship entails evaluating different candidate applications and workloads to identify the best examples that show differentiation on Intel's platforms from a performance, power, usability perspective, then weaving a story and a demo to showcase them, followed by creation of assets so that our field and sales organizations can recreate and repurpose the demos and show them to external customers.

For this you need strong technical and communication skills, as you will translate engineering specifications into customer benefits and test and generate workloads to communicate these benefits effectively. We look for self-motivated, creative and disciplined individuals who are good listeners, collaborators and communicators and who take a personal interest in tinkering with hardware.

Pharmapace, Inc. is a consulting and contract Clinical Research Organization (“CRO”) founded by several veteran leaders in the biotech/pharmaceutical industry who are recognized as experts in their respective fields. The Job

WarnerMedia seeks a Virtual HBOMax Software Engineering Intern for the Direct to Consumer department.

Build the future of Streaming Media with us! We are the team that architects, codifies, owns and operates the scalable and resilient infrastructure that powers HBO’s flagship streaming products HBO Max and HBO Go. Our products are enjoyed by millions of customers around the world. We are software engineers with a passion for infrastructure, automation, tooling and security. Building reliability, performance and security into our streaming products is our mission. We are evangelists for infrastructure as code, continuous delivery, operational visibility and strongly believe that automation is the key to delivering reliable systems. We are looking for a senior engineer to help us expand our infrastructure as code efforts and to help us scale HBO Max globally!

The Daily
  • Architect, codify and build out the international infrastructure platform for HBO Max, expanding and adapting our existing platform to a global audience.
  • Champion best practices and uphold a culture that is committed to quality, test driven development and repeatable processes through automation and infrastructure as code
  • Develop and support core functionality and components to support traffic shaping/routing
  • Build security into our systems and infrastructure to avert disruption and maintain uptime
  • Design & develop tooling that ensures resiliency and redundancy for our infrastructure with an eye towards reducing mean time to recovery in failure scenarios. Passion for making production deployments and severity events boring and uneventful
  • Develop tooling and services that provide real time insight into service and system health for a large distributed system
  • Collaborate with other world-class software engineers across HBO to deliver ground-breaking content and features for the future of streaming media

  • A bachelor’s or master’s degree in engineering, computer science or related field
  • 1+ year programming experience in C++ or C# or similar programming languages
  • Ability to easily switch between independent and collaborative work
  • Strong communication, problem solving and time management skills
  • Multi-f luency with C, C++, Objective-C, Java, JavaScript, and HTML5/CSS
  • Experience with devices such as tablets, smart phones, and game consoles
  • OS: Windows, iOS, Android, MacOS, Linux

The internship will be a full remote/virtual experience. Most internships will provide a company owned laptop for the duration of the internship program. Interns are paid a competitive wage based on team/bureau location and relocation is not provided as the program is fully remote/virtual.

position: Machine Learning and Deep Learning Intern
description:
Job Summary:
Baidu Autonomous Driving Technology Department (ADT), located in Silicon Valley CA, is offering R&D internships primarily focusing on utilizing machine learning and deep learning technologies in autonomous driving for the summer and fall 2021. As an intern, you will have the opportunity of working with a group of engineers and researchers to design, develop, and test the next generation of algorithms and technology in driverless technology that will completely transform and innovate the mobility in the future.

Here's what we'd like to see in you:
Ph.D. / MS student in Computer Science (or equivalent).

Research background and hands-on experience in machine learning and deep learning

Proficient programming skills in Python and C/C++.

Experience with one or more major deep learning platforms.

Research interests in CNN, GAN, IRL, GCN or imitation learning with publication records in top venues (ICCV/CVPR/ICRA/IROS and etc.) and experience in autonomous driving is a plus

Culture Fit:
Mission alignment: If you want to be part of a team to accomplish this great mission, we will provide you the best possible platform to do that.

Self­-directed: We work best with people that are driven, motivated, and aspire to greatness. Are you the sort of person that, if you had time on your hands, will independently find interesting and useful things to do?

Hungry to learn: We are eager to see you learn new skills and grow. But learning is hard work and this is something we hope you want to do.

Team orientation: We work in small, fast­-moving teams. We don't believe in lone wolves. We watch out for each other and go after big goals together as a team.

LifeSpan Fitness is excited to be offering an entry level software development position. We aim to help students get work experience prior to graduation. You will be responsible for helping implement coded solutions for our ERP platform NetSuite. NetSuite uses their own coding language called SuiteScript, but is modeled almost entirely off of JavaScript.

We are also in the process of moving our webstore from the eCommerce platform Magento, to Shopify. Shopify aims to give users the tools to make changes to their website with little coding experience. Shopify does have a template language - Liquid, which is a simplified version of HTML.

This position will help you identify issues in the business world and find system oriented solutions to these problems. While you will be working with a team daily, much of the teamwork will be with other departments and the small IT team.

We aren't looking for the most experienced coder. We're looking for someone who's got the drive to learn and is willing to research problems independently.

Qualifications

-Some knowledge of coding languages JavaScript and HTML.

-Pursuing a degree in Computer Science or Information Systems is recommended but not required. Recent graduates or self taught individuals will also be considered.

-Excellent communication skills.

-Aptitude for troubleshooting and resourcefulness. Problem solving skills are a must.

Position is part-time. $13-$15/Hr. Expecting 20-30Hrs a week depending on workload and candidates skillset.

For highest chance of consideration, please apply directly on our website - https://www.lifespanfitness.com/blog/careers/

About LifeSpan Fitness:

LifeSpan Fitness is dedicated to benefiting the way people work, exercise, and live in sustainable, healthy ways. Our quality products and innovative vision have inspired fitness and wellness as a way of everyday life since we introduced the brand in 2001. By specializing in solutions created uniquely for the home, gym, workplace, and everywhere in between, LifeSpan is helping to empower individuals to find better health regardless of the setting.
