position: Network System Engineer Summer Intern - Bethesda, Maryland
description:
Icomera US, Inc., a fast-growing technology company headquartered in Sweden, is looking for upper-division undergraduate (junior / senior) or graduate students currently studying an engineering discipline to join our growing Solutions Engagement team in Bethesda, Maryland.

Icomera is committed to students pursuing science, technology, engineering, and mathematics (STEM) by offering the opportunity to develop and advance their careers. Here, you will be rewarded with an ever-changing, quality-oriented environment that provides everyone with the chance to learn and challenge themselves every day. The intern will gain a vast array of experience in their area of study as well as have the chance to learn and work with other business areas.


About the Job:

The Role

Icomera is looking for a Network Systems Engineer intern to learn, create, and deliver comprehensive connected vehicle solutions that meet the needs of our clients. Your role will include developing well-written software applications in tasks of low to moderate complexity in collaboration with our software engineering staff. This will be an integral part of our efforts to develop and implement customer product solutions for the transportation market. You will assist with the development of products to achieve technology objectives, deployment processes, and support current / future technology trends.


Responsibilities

  • Support Wi-Fi designs to include electrical schema design, interface material design, including cable lengths, connectors, inter-vehicle jumpers, roof antenna positions.
  • Assist in configuring network switches and routers for production and performing quality checks before installation
  • Support quality audits of installed designs ensuring they are accurate from a system interface perspective
  • Ensure all supplied components are allocated part numbers that are correctly stated on the installation drawings
  • Should be comfortable working with Linux OS
  • Should be comfortable executing a variety of concurrent hardware and software assignments
  • Assist in setting up Engineering Lab
  • Assist in developing and documenting procedures and processes
  • Gather system requirements, building test cases against those, and preparing the documentation for each test scenario
  • Execute test scenarios and prepare test report
  • Document and report system bugs to the appropriate development teams
  • Perform effective problem resolution
  • Document deployment steps
  • Create the maintenance documentation (instructions for replacing faulty components)
  • Document the system configuration and update the internal knowledge base (Wiki)
  • Mark up any changes/modifications, ensuring that these changes are modified for the production installation

We believe you should have:

  • A passion and desire to excel in engineering and deliver technical services
  • Willingness to make decisions
  • Good communications skills
  • Support-focused mindset and conflict resolution experience
  • Able to analyze problems and recommend solutions
  • Ability to cope with changing environment – including adapting to meet emergency business critical events
  • Happy to challenge existing processes and procedures and contribute to ideas and suggestions for improvement
  • Resourcefulness and troubleshooting aptitude
  • Enthusiastic team player with a strong work ethic
  • Networking knowledge including Ethernet, TCP/IP, OSI model, routing and switching.
  • Working knowledge of routers and switches in a lab environment, course work or technical support position
  • Experience in scripting languages such as Pearl, Python, coding for creating test scripts

Additional experience with following is seen as a plus

  • Experience in working within the Wi-Fi or passenger transport industries
  • Experience of ITIL and ISO 27001
  • Knowledge of the mobile network landscape and technologies

Qualifications

  • Actively pursuing an undergraduate (BS) or graduate (MS) degree in Computer Engineering, Information Technology, Information Systems Management, Software Engineering, or similar field of study. This requirement may be substituted with a minimum 1 year of applied (professionally employed) software development experience
  • Familiarity with Linux or another Unix variant
  • Familiar with Virtualization platform VirtualBox or VMware
  • Excellent communication skills; both written and oral
  • Resourcefulness and troubleshooting aptitude
  • Enthusiastic team player with a strong work ethic
  • Experience working in accordance with established processes

Our Offer

  • An excellent team-focused working environment with huge visibility for your efforts
  • An opportunity to be a part of a truly innovative and fast-growing market
  • A chance to make your mark on the future of technology for transport
  • A competitive wage
  • An extremely flexible, fun, and varied schedule

Does this sound like an interesting challenge for you?

You will be a part of a company that is a contributor to future technology for public transportation and which is growing rapidly. You will also be a member of a team focused environment and your workday will be fun, flexible and varied. Send your application to recruitment@icomera.com

Apply today for the possibility of becoming a part of our team!


We are always looking for the best talent. Icomera is headquartered in Gothenburg, Sweden, with main offices in the United Kingdom, Germany, France, Italy, the United States, and Canada. We are happy to accept applications from anyone who already has the right to work in these countries (for example, EU citizenship).

Please send your CV and covering letter to recruitment@icomera.com.

We only engage in direct recruitment; calls or CVs received via recruitment agencies will not be accepted.

Charter Manufacturing is a fourth-generation family-owned business where our will to grow drives us to do it better. Join the team and become part of our family!

Charter Manufacturing's Corporate IT team is seeking an IT Intern to support the Server Infrastructure group!

Grow through Charter’s Internship values of communication, high expectations, accountability, responsibility, teamwork, exposure to business, and real-world work experience.

  • Cumulative GPA of 2.75 or higher
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office software: Excel, Word, and PowerPoint
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Strong interpersonal and relationship building skills
  • Ability to succeed in a team environment
  • Ability to handle multiple tasks
  • Basic Network and security fundamentals

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:

  • One year of IT-related experience
  • Strong network understanding and desire to learn enterprise server infrastructure technologies
  • Analytical with strong troubleshooting and technical skills
  • Knowledge of Windows / Linux server operating systems
  • Knowledge of scripting languages, PowerShell/Bash/Python
  • Ability to create and maintain server infrastructure documentation, preferably using Microsoft Visio
  • Conceptual knowledge of network and data center environments
  • Knowledge of virtualization concepts and technologies

MAJOR ACCOUNTABILITIES:

  • Participate in Continuous Improvement projects
  • Assist in other projects and function as a resource for other team members
  • Document and improve processes
  • Ability to meet the essential job requirements, with or without reasonable accommodation, as outlined in the job description
  • Follow Environmental, Quality and Safety Management System procedures and requirements
  • Gain experience maintaining and supporting Charter’s Microsoft Office 365 environment, Active Directory and hyper-converged virtualization infrastructure

POSITION CHALLENGES:

  • Juggling multiple responsibilities
  • Prioritizing day-to-day tasks and project work
  • Some travel when needed

Job Description


We Believe in Better!

We are a global information technology company that builds high-performance, security-centric solutions that can help change the world. Enhancing people’s lives through secure, reliable advanced technology is our vision.

At Unisys, we believe in better! Here, you have the opportunity to learn new skills, apply your expertise, and solve complex problems with cutting edge technologies and solutions. You are part of a global diverse team that supports you, drives change, and delivers successful results consistently.

Our associates are at the forefront of everything we do, driving our clients’ successes while giving back to communities and making this world a safer and more secure place to live and work. Our success is a direct result of the work of our people who live and breathe our Core Beliefs. Simply put, we believe in better lives. Join us!

Learn more about Unisys and our key solution offerings: Unisys, Stealth™, CloudForte®, InteliServe™

What success looks like in this role:

A technical student attached to Unisys for a period of time such as a summer intern or co-op student. Key Responsibilities 1. Uses learned processes, standards, and tools on assigned project(s). 2. Learns a product, tool, or technical area relying on technical staff for domain knowledge. 3. Participates in different phases of software development (e.g. design, implementation, support, etc.). 4. Works independently or as an effective team member. 5. Identifies and escalates issues as required. 6. Gains awareness of requirements in area of defined tasks. 7. Receives and understands projects and task estimates from senior staff members. 8. Under direction or guidance, executes well defined tasks of limited scope and duration such as the: a. implements simple features b. writes clear and accurate documentation that supports implementation, problem analysis and/or problem resolutions c. set-up and maintain system software development environments d. execute prewritten tests e. writes and/or reviews test cases for clarity and accuracy f. Implements test cases g. gathers information to assist in problem analysis and resolution h. fixes simple defects/problems in defined areas of code 9. Provides status (written or verbal) on work efforts as required

You will be successful in this role if you have:

Key Qualifications • Student enrolled in Bachelor or Master degree program majoring in Computer Science, Computer Engineer, Mathematics or related discipline • Knowledge of basic software engineering concepts • Problem solving • Familiar with SDLC (software development life cycle) concepts • Familiar with one or more programming language(s) • Able to learn and apply new technologies quickly • Has a natural curiosity for technology • Able to work effectively in a team oriented environment or as an independent contributor • Good written and verbal communication skills

position: 2022 - Summer - Consulting Intern - Management Consulting - Human Capital
description:
As a Management Consulting (MC) intern at RSM, you will work with mid-sized businesses in diverse industries and receive hands-on client experience with direct access to executive management. Assigned to numerous projects, you will work on several pieces of any particular assignment—not just one small part—and you will feel a great sense of accomplishment on what you learned once done. Working in a mutually respectful team environment helps our consultants perform at their best and advance their career and professional capabilities.
RSM’s MC practice helps businesses accelerate their future. Our Management Consultants are passionate about innovating to drive business growth. Our collaborative approach incorporates industry and functional expertise with a focus on intelligent automation to optimize and enhance the efficiency of business operations. Our core offerings include business transformation and improvement services for finance and accounting, technology, human capital, supply chain and operations leaders, along with strategy execution services to drive projects from start to finish.
Consultants provide quality professional services to RSM's clients by performing the duties and responsibilities listed below:
  • Meet with clients and conducting management consulting projects based on client needs

Job Description

Position Summary

We are looking for a Lab Technician with the desire to participate in hands-on learning in the wine industry during Harvest 2021. Validate compliance to product specifications and adherence to GMP’s through routine and advanced chemical analyses on juices, wines, Spirits, and other Company products. Communicate with and provide feedback to production team members to facilitate process improvement. This position follows standard work methods and practices safe work habits to ensure production is as efficient and safe as possible.

This is a temporary assignment, generally between August through November. Schedules are determined on an as needed basis to keep up with grape processing. This may include weekend work, and overtime.

Responsibilities:

  • Learn and follow all laboratory work instructions and safety procedures.
  • Standardize equipment as needed and ensure it is working properly.
  • Perform accurate routine and advanced chemical and physical analysis on wines, juices, concentrates and other company products.
  • Collect samples from tanks and barrels, prepare samples for analysis.
  • Prepare reagents and standard solutions.
  • Prepare, maintain, and distribute required reports and records.
  • Contribute to producing quality products by completing assignments in a safe, efficient and valuable manner.
  • Maintain lab cleanliness and a safe, sanitary working environment.
  • Compliance with all Company policies and procedures.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Ability to work from June through the end of November.
  • Ability to work various shifts including weekends and overtime
  • Recent graduate or pursuing a degree in Food Science, Chemistry or related field
  • Strong knowledge of analytical procedures.
  • Strong knowledge of mathematics.
  • Strong attention to detail and ability to precisely follow directions.
  • Experience in computer applications (Excel, Word, and Outlook).
  • Must be 21 years of age.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Previous lab experience
  • Knowledge of various wine types
  • Ability to handle multiple tasks.
  • Strong interpersonal skills.
  • Experience with MS Teams and Sharepoint

Working Conditions/Physical Requirements:

Working conditions in certain areas of the winery are cold, warm, wet, slippery and noisy. Involves exposure to loud noises, fumes, toxic chemicals, near moving mechanical parts and lift truck traffic. Frequent walking, standing, sitting, stooping, kneeling, crouch or crawl, going up and down stairs and ladders. Must be able to move up to 55 lbs. Must have a valid driver’s license. Occasional travel with ability to work weekends and overtime. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Location

Oakville, California

Full time

Internships

Job Description


We are looking for an energetic intern who has a passion for technology and working with gaming and media applications across multiple platforms. In this internship you will work with a dynamic team that pulls together compelling demos that showcase the features of Intel's latest platforms. We create new usages and experiences and show Intel's competitive advantage on PC's and mobile devices.

We collaborate with marketing, engineering, sales and development groups to make sure we have the best examples of software that makes hardware shine - and our work directly affects the sales of Intel client platforms. Once we have created these experiences, we collaborate with different parts of the company and we participate in trade shows to evangelize them. In this internship you will gain expertise in the client software ecosystem and how to develop marketing and sales collateral to support the platform value proposition.

The internship entails evaluating different candidate applications and workloads to identify the best examples that show differentiation on Intel's platforms from a performance, power, usability perspective, then weaving a story and a demo to showcase them, followed by creation of assets so that our field and sales organizations can recreate and repurpose the demos and show them to external customers.

For this you need strong technical and communication skills, as you will translate engineering specifications into customer benefits and test and generate workloads to communicate these benefits effectively. We look for self-motivated, creative and disciplined individuals who are good listeners, collaborators and communicators and who take a personal interest in tinkering with hardware.


Qualifications


You must possess the below minimum qualifications to be initially considered for the position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates. Experience listed below could be obtained through a combination of your school work/classes/research and/or relevant previous jobs/internship experiences.

Minimum Requirements

This position is not eligible for employment-based visa/immigration sponsorship. Intel sponsors individuals for employment-based visas for positions where we experience a shortage of US Workers. These skills shortage roles are typically STEM contributing positions requiring a Master's or PhD degree, or a Bachelor’s degree with three years’ related job experience. This position does not qualify for Intel Sponsorship because it is either (1) a non-STEM contributing position, or (2) a STEM position that only requires a Bachelor’s degree and less than three years’ experience.

Candidate must be pursuing a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering or related.

3+ months of experience with:

  • Gaming, content creation or artificial intelligence

  • Trouble shooting hardware and software

  • Installing applications, operating systems and hardware components

  • Software programming / scripting experience (Python, C/C++ or C#)

Availability to work onsite at the Hillsboro, Oregon site


Preferred Qualifications

3+ months experience with:

  • Video or picture editing software

  • Application test methodology and repeatable testing process for workloads

Inside this Business Group


Intel Architecture, Graphics, and Software (IAGS) brings Intel's technical strategy to life. We have embraced the new reality of competing at a product and solution level—not just a transistor one. We take pride in reshaping the status quo and thinking exponentially to achieve what's never been done before. We've also built a culture of continuous learning and persistent leadership that provides opportunities to practice until perfection and filter ambitious ideas into execution.

position: undergraduate intern, information security engineer - Fall 2021 - remote
description:
From the beginning, Starbucks set out to be a different kind of company. One that not only celebrated coffee and its rich tradition, but that also brought a feeling of connection.

During the Starbucks Technology Internship Program, you will:

  • Influence business performance: make an impact through meaningful project work.

  • Develop professionally: enhance your skills at workshops and business overviews.

  • Foster connection: grow your network as you meet and learn from senior Starbucks leaders.

About Starbucks Global Cybersecurity Services

Cybersecurity at Starbucks is defined by the mission to protect the brand and its digital footprint. As a consistently awarded “most recognized brand,” the responsibility requires multiple services to remain successful. These services include, but are not limited to, mobile device management, application security, endpoint protection, identity and access services, vulnerability management, and various programs that provide cybersecurity oversight to the enterprise. All of these together establish Starbucks as a leader in retail cybersecurity services. As a key member of our team, you will assist us in developing and improving cybersecurity services that protect our brand, our customers, and our partners.

We’d love to hear from students with:

  • Bachelors student with Cybersecurity background (course work and/or project delivery) highly desired.

  • Currently enrolled in an undergraduate Computer Science or Software Engineering degree program

  • Prior experience with automation leveraging scripting languages (e.g. Python, PowerShell).

  • Completed coursework or experience in Cybersecurity, Java, SQL, data structures, and/or database systems preferred.

  • Understanding of algorithms, systems architecture, and end-user experience.

  • Familiarity with cybersecurity and cloud technologies.

  • Network security familiarity and/or direct experience.

  • Superior strategic thinking and problem-solving skills.

  • Ability to work both independently and as part of a team.

  • Strong relationship management and interpersonal skills.

  • Ability to communicate clearly and concisely, both orally and in writing.

  • Mid-level programming experience; ability to build prototypes and understand existing code base.

  • Attention to detail and ability to thoroughly think through problems.

About the Starbucks Summer Internship Program:

The Starbucks Technology Internship Program is a paid full-time program, designed to provide students with an opportunity to gain meaningful work experience in a field of interest and expertise within the Starbucks Technology Enterprise.


Internship Program Qualifications:

  • Active enrollment in an accredited Undergraduate program

  • Preferred (but not required) minimum cumulative Grade Point Average (GPA) of 3.0

  • Ability to work for a minimum of 20 hours per week

  • Expected graduation between December 2021 - August 2022

  • Eligibility to work in the United States




Starbucks and its brands are an equal opportunity employer of all qualified individuals.

We are committed to creating a diverse and welcoming workplace that includes partners with diverse backgrounds and experiences. We believe that enables us to better meet our mission and values while serving customers throughout our global communities. People of color, women, LGBTQIA+, veterans and persons with disabilities are encouraged to apply.

Qualified applicants with criminal histories will be considered for employment in a manner consistent with all federal state and local ordinances. Starbucks Corporation is committed to offering reasonable accommodations to job applicants with disabilities. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please contact us at 206-318-0660 or via email at applicantaccommodation@starbucks.com

position: Virtual HBOmax Software Engineering Intern, Fall 2021
description:
Company Overview

WarnerMedia is a leading media and entertainment company that creates and distributes premium and popular content from a diverse array of talented storytellers and journalists to global audiences through its consumer brands including: HBO, HBO Max, Warner Bros., TNT, TBS, truTV, CNN, DC Entertainment, New Line, Cartoon Network, Adult Swim, Turner Classic Movies and others.

HBO is one of the most respected and innovative entertainment brands in the world, serving iconic, award-winning programming to 140 million subscribers globally. A subsidiary of WarnerMedia, HBO is the world’s most successful pay TV service with an extensive array of programming that includes some of the most notable titles to be on television, including drama series Succession®, Watchmen®, Westworld®, Big Little Lies®, Game of Thrones®, The Sopranos®, Band of Brothers® and The Wire®, as well as comedy series Barry®, Insecure® and Sex and the City®. HBO is committed to retaining and recruiting skilled and motivated employees, placing a priority on qualified team players who contribute to the diversity of their workforce. HBO offers competitive benefits to include medical, dental, vision, a matched 401(k) plan, flexible spending, a commuter benefit program and tuition reimbursement.

Opportunity Overview

Application Deadline: Monday, June 14

The Job

WarnerMedia seeks a Virtual HBOMax Software Engineering Intern for the Direct to Consumer department.

Build the future of Streaming Media with us! We are the team that architects, codifies, owns and operates the scalable and resilient infrastructure that powers HBO’s flagship streaming products HBO Max and HBO Go. Our products are enjoyed by millions of customers around the world. We are software engineers with a passion for infrastructure, automation, tooling and security. Building reliability, performance and security into our streaming products is our mission. We are evangelists for infrastructure as code, continuous delivery, operational visibility and strongly believe that automation is the key to delivering reliable systems. We are looking for a senior engineer to help us expand our infrastructure as code efforts and to help us scale HBO Max globally!

The Daily
  • Architect, codify and build out the international infrastructure platform for HBO Max, expanding and adapting our existing platform to a global audience.
  • Champion best practices and uphold a culture that is committed to quality, test driven development and repeatable processes through automation and infrastructure as code
  • Develop and support core functionality and components to support traffic shaping/routing
  • Build security into our systems and infrastructure to avert disruption and maintain uptime
  • Design & develop tooling that ensures resiliency and redundancy for our infrastructure with an eye towards reducing mean time to recovery in failure scenarios. Passion for making production deployments and severity events boring and uneventful
  • Develop tooling and services that provide real time insight into service and system health for a large distributed system
  • Collaborate with other world-class software engineers across HBO to deliver ground-breaking content and features for the future of streaming media

The Essentials
  • A bachelor’s or master’s degree in engineering, computer science or related field
  • 1+ year programming experience in C++ or C# or similar programming languages
  • Ability to easily switch between independent and collaborative work
  • Strong communication, problem solving and time management skills
  • Multi-f luency with C, C++, Objective-C, Java, JavaScript, and HTML5/CSS
  • Experience with devices such as tablets, smart phones, and game consoles
  • OS: Windows, iOS, Android, MacOS, Linux

Internship Program
  • Students must be currently enrolled in a college degree program for full duration of the internship.
  • Fully remote/virtual experience; company owned laptop provided for the duration of the internship program.
  • Salary based on office location; relocation is not provided.
  • This position is targeted toward upperclassmen and graduate students.

The internship will be a full remote/virtual experience. Most internships will provide a company owned laptop for the duration of the internship program. Interns are paid a competitive wage based on team/bureau location and relocation is not provided as the program is fully remote/virtual.

Overview:

Pharmapace, Inc. is a consulting and contract Clinical Research Organization (“CRO”) founded by several veteran leaders in the biotech/pharmaceutical industry who are recognized as experts in their respective fields. The core mission of Pharmapace is to deliver exceptional value to the life sciences industry (biotech/pharmaceutical companies) by providing high-quality consulting and outsourcing services to support our customer’s clinical trials, regulatory submissions, medical affairs, safety surveillance, and outcomes research programs to help patients afflicted with a wide range of disease conditions. We have a particular emphasis in Biometrics services. Since our founding in 2013, Pharmapace has successfully assisted numerous life sciences companies in their drug development programs. Many of our Sponsors’ drugs that we have worked on, have received approval by the US Food and Drug Administration. We take great pride in what we do to help our valued customers to advance human health.


In early 2019, Pharmapace was acquired by WuXi AppTec, a leading global contract development and manufacturing organization that serves over 4,000 biopharmaceutical and medical device companies worldwide. Pharmapace remains committed to delivering exceptional services and value to our customers. Pharmapace is an integral part of WuXi Clinical Development Inc. (CRO), a division of WuXi Apptec, which has offices in Austin, Texas, Taiwan, and China. This combination allows us to leverage on WuXi Clinical’s vast resources and offer our customers a truly global solution to all aspects of clinical/drug development and regulatory submission.
Responsibilities:

Job Title: Intern Analyst (Summer)


Job Location: Pharmapace, San Diego, CA


Position Summary:

Contributes to the completion of routine technical tasks by performing dataset programming, graphic data presentation, and statistical analyses as part of the Clinical and Statistical Programming (CSP) team to support client drug development projects..


Essential Job Functions:

  • Assist CSP members with transforming specifications in statistical analyses plan into fully documented, validated programs supporting both safety and efficacy displays and analysis datasets required for clinical study reports
  • Assist in testing, maintaining, and documenting programs for use in creating study datasets in standard data tabulation model format, analysis datasets, statistical tables, figures, and listings
  • Assist Clinical Data Management with creating well-documented validated standard and non-standard edit check and monitoring programs to support the clinical trial team to ensure the integrity, accuracy and completeness of the data in preparation for clinical reporting
  • Adhere to statistical analysis plans and standard operating procedures while completing routine programming activities
  • Meet milestones as assigned with high quality
  • Perform other duties as directed by management or senior programming personnel
Qualifications:
Education:

Bachelor’s or above degree in Statistics/Biostatistics, Computer Science, or Mathematics


Experience Requirements:

Minimum 1 year of experience with SAS or R for Bachelor’s degree


Skills:

  • Basic knowledge of R or Base SAS, including SAS macro language, is preferred. Programming experience in a research environment is a plus
  • Credits in Statistics courses are desired
  • Understands the sequence of running programs to ensure up-to-date data and to troubleshoot, debug programming problems and to identify data trends
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, and PowerPoint)
  • Effective verbal and writing skills


Physical Requirements:

  • Must be able to work in an office environment, which has minimal noise conditions
  • Ability to stand or sit for most of the work day
  • Must be able to perform some activities with repetitive motion, such as keyboarding

This job description does not state or imply that the above are the only duties and responsibilities assigned to this position. Employees holding this position will be required to perform any other job-related duties as requested by Management.


An Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

Company Overview

WarnerMedia is a leading media and entertainment company that creates and distributes premium and popular content from a diverse array of talented storytellers and journalists to global audiences through its consumer brands including: HBO, HBO Max, Warner Bros., TNT, TBS, truTV, CNN, DC Entertainment, New Line, Cartoon Network, Adult Swim, Turner Classic Movies and others.

Opportunity Overview

The Team

WarnerMedia’s Kids, Young Adults and Classics (KYAC) Content Operations team tracks and coordinates delivery of metadata, production milestones, premiere dates, production assets, and programming (with special security considerations). We work closely with programming, marketing, studios, producers, and technology operations teams in order to make sure the linear, streaming and global presentations of all of our networks, brands, shows and products adhere to strategy.

The Job

WarnerMedia seeks an Intern for the Programming TCM-TCM department.

The Daily

The student will be learning and assisting the team with the following:
  • Previewing promos and programming for accuracy, quality, closed captioning, length, formatting, edits, etc.
  • Working in databases to update production and premiere dates, genres, storylines, ratings, participants, etc.
  • Coordinate and respond to requests for information and assets from different internal and external partners domestically and globally.

The Essentials
  • Be a fan of WarnerMedia characters, films and shows
  • Knowledge of production processes
  • Computer skills – MS Office, database management
  • Extreme attention to detail
  • Good writing skills

But Wait, There’s More!

The Perks

  • Exclusive WarnerMedia events and advance screenings
  • Paid time off every year to volunteer for eligible employees
  • Access to well-being tools, resources, and freebies
  • Access to in-house learning and development resources
  • Part of the WarnerMedia family of powerhouse brands

Qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, mental or physical disability, and genetic information, marital status, citizenship status, military status, protected veteran status or any other category protected by law.

About SimplePart :
SimplePart builds smart world-class eCommerce and Electronic Parts Catalog (EPC) solutions for the world's leading automakers. If you've bought an OEM car part online from a car dealer in the last decade, you likely used SimplePart's technology. Our marketing, platform and data connects more than 9 million monthly online shoppers to the parts, accessories and service they need to keep their cars running.

SimplePart aspires to reflect the diverse audiences we serve, by building a community of rich and diverse perspectives, ideas, backgrounds and cultures. We're looking for fresh ideas from all areas.

We are and will always be a data and engineering company - our products handle information at massive scale, extending well beyond off-the-shelf eCommerce. Our teams are fast-paced, versatile and ready to take on technology's greatest challenges and make an impact on millions of users.

The Development Team:
On SimplePart's Platform Development Team you have the chance to brainstorm, collaborate and grow alongside some of the best and brightest engineers in the world. We are all commonly focused on delivering the best possible product and experience to our customers. As a group, we rally together to create responsive and elegant web applications that scale to millions of users in dozens of countries and languages.

We are looking for active engagement, and an iterative mindset from everyone on the team. We'll hit "perfect" not all at once, but by steadily iterating and learning over time. As a mature, stable platform, our primary focus is new development. In this, each member of the team has the ability to impact all aspects of the development process.

The Job:
As an Intern on the Development Team you will be working alongside the larger team developing Stored Procedures and Functions in t-SQL in support of new capabilities for our Platform. This is an application development role working in Microsoft SQL Server. This is a role where you will see your work in Production right away, serving millions of shoppers for some of the world's most recognized brands.

Qualifications:
Experience developing with t-SQL
Open to candidates of all backgrounds and experience levels
This is a paid part-time position with the opportunity to grow into full time

Every role on the team is a hands-on position, working in a hybrid agile (two week sprint) model building big, meaningful new technology at the cutting edge of digital commerce for some of the world's biggest and most recognizable brands. Our stack is SQL (stored procedures), C# and Vue.js running a Component model on top of Webforms. We host on owned equipment (not cloud) and we do no outsourcing or offshore work of any kind. This is a fun, flexible, iterative team focused exclusively on our eCommerce and EPC platform. You will help us build crisp, clean, interactive experiences to make complex catalogs of millions of products accessible and easy to understand for most people.

It's not just about deploying code. Community, learning, growth and professional development are key values of the team - and we make time to celebrate and reflect.

We offer our employees:
Company paid health/dental/vision/life/disability benefits
Competitive pay
Medical FSA
Dependent Care FSA with company contribution
401k plan with company match
Maternity/Paternity leave
Tuition assistance
Flexible vacation
Vacation bonus
Commuter benefits
Friday lunches
Dog friendly office

SimplePart is an established, solidly profitable company headquartered in Downtown Atlanta's Fairlie Poplar District. If you are interested in joining our collaborative group, please apply below. In your application, please be sure to include a cover letter that gives us an idea of your personality, who you are and what you're all about. We look forward to hearing from you! Be a part of a team of ambitious, lifelong learners who enjoy making an impact and challenging themselves each day.

SimplePart is an equal opportunity employer, and we value diversity at our company. We don't discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Candidates must be authorized to work in the U.S. without sponsorship. No recruiters, please.

Hourly Rate: $15-$25/hr

This is a pipeline requisition for potential future openings. It does not indicate that a job opening currently exists at NI for this position. When a position becomes available that fits your background and experience, someone from our recruiting team will be in contact.

Please Note: NI does NOT petition for H-1B status from student visas for full-time Technical Writer hires, thus cannot accept candidates for this intern position who are on a student visa and have Curriculum Practical Training (CPT), Optional Practical Training (OPT), or academic training.

Technical writing interns work within product teams in the Research and Development organization. Potential projects include rewriting content to fit the DITA model, editing product documentation, creating product documentation in print and electronic format, and testing NI documentation with their respective NI products.


From this internship, you can expect to develop fundamental skills you can use to build your career as a technical writer:

  • Information gathering
  • Technical skills
  • Written and verbal communication
  • Problem solving
  • Teamwork and cooperation
  • Time management and organization

Required skills

  • Pursuing bachelor's degree or higher in Technical Communications, English, Journalism, or other major with writing-intensive component and/or science/technology emphasis
  • Must be a current student in good standing
  • Interest in exploring a technical writing career
  • Strong verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills - must provide samples of excellent writing skills, preferably of technical content
  • Demonstrated technical interest and aptitude
    • Comfortable conducting research and asking questions to understand technical material
    • Ability to learn new ideas quickly
    • Strong interest in and comfort with technical subject matter
  • Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail
  • Persistence and initiative to learn
  • Ability to work effectively in a group environment
  • English Language Competency: Ability to clearly and concisely communicate in English (verbal and written) so that persons you work with can understand you clearly, particularly in technical conversation.
Prefer experience in at least one of the following areas:
  • Prior work experience and/or extracurricular activities with focus on writing or editing; for example, working as a writing tutor or writing for a student newspaper.
  • Prefer experience writing or editing content with technical subject matter.
  • Coursework in mathematics and/or science
    • Prefer knowledge of computer programming basics and/or completion of some computer science/programming coursework
  • Experience with a markup language, such as HTML or XML
Successfully completing one or more Technical Writing Intern positions may lead to an offer for a rewarding, full-time technical writing position.

Required Application Materials:
  • Resume
  • Cover Letter
  • 2 Original Writing Samples
    • o Each sample should be 500-1,000 words in length, and at least one sample should be a technical procedure. For example, you might submit a how-to document for completing a task in your favorite software application. The samples may be excerpts from larger works but should be complete enough to stand on their own.

Is this you? A student studying computer science, IT, programming, and computer engineering who is interested in learning more about Application Development. If you want to do amazing work, learn about cloud solutions, and have a little fun along the way with good people, then this internship is for you!

Who are we? So glad you asked! Jelecos is a technology consulting company headquartered in Omaha, NE that specializes in AWS cloud solutions. We’re an AWS Advanced Consulting Partner and Certified Solution Provider focused on migration, optimization, transformation and cloud-first application consulting.

What would you do? The Application Developer Intern’s role, under the guidance of an intern mentor, is responsible for the technical aspects of architecting and developing solutions in conjunction with the Application Services and Infrastructure Services teams. The role has responsibility for ensuring systems and applications are maintained, supported, and upgraded based on industry best practices and established company standards, policies, and procedures with keen attention to the quality of service and deliverables produced for clients. This individual will apply proven communication skills, problem-solving skills, and will strive to learn the best practices of cloud development, systems and security. Support both internal and external project-related activities for Cloud deployment and automation.

What are the details?

  • Participate in application development projects for our customers
  • Develop automation scripts, plugins and apps to monitor the availability and security of our platform
  • Assist in application deployments, testing and building new automation systems
  • Contribute to the creation of system support documents, and ops processes
  • Learn on the job and explore new technologies

What do you know?

Knowledge and Experience:

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Solid analytical, problem solving / troubleshooting skills
  • Familiarity with AWS-based development is a plus
  • Experience with programming in languages like C# .NET, Python, NodeJS, JavaScript ES6, and front-end tools like Angular, VueJS
  • Some knowledge of relational database systems
  • Ability and passion to learn, research, and test new technologies

Requirements:

  • Ability to work 20-30 hours per week between 8am - 5pm, M-F.
  • An eligible student intern is any person who:
    • is enrolled full-time in a college or university and has achieved senior status by such institution's criteria; or
    • applies within six months following graduation from a college, university, or other institution of higher education

What do you get from us?

  • Casual atmosphere
  • Recognition program
  • Fun company events
  • Referral program
  • A great place to spend most of your time and more!

Internship Details:

  • Hourly wage: $18.00 - $22.00 per hour
  • Internship duration: 6 months
  • This is not a remote position; you must be able to work at our Omaha office

Jelecos provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, ancestry, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, marital status, religion, age, disability, gender identity, results of genetic testing, service in the military, or any other legally protected characteristic.

Digital Technology Intern

Summary:

This position will help you identify issues in the business world and find system oriented solutions to these problems. While you will be working with a team daily, much of the teamwork will be with other departments and the small IT team.

Job Statement
SJCPL is looking for a creative, enthusiastic, and self-motivated person to help develop fun summer programming for youth and their families. As an intern, you will provide support to staff for our annual Summer Reading Challenge, help plan and implement programs, and provide bilingual assistance to staff and library patrons. This person will have the opportunity to gain experience working with youth and their families.
A job at SJCPL is a chance to give back to the community while also gaining real life experience in a dynamic and challenging environment. People who work at a Library are committed to public service (and also get to spend their day surrounded by books).
Once here you will:
  • Become familiar with children’s literature, materials, resources, and library services.
  • Promote our annual Summer Reading Challenge to families.
  • Help plan and present a program such as a bilingual storytime or activity for youth and their families, create a community art or multimedia activity, or share your passion by creating your own unique project.
  • Assist with library programs for a variety of age groups.
  • Visit library branch locations, assist with occasional off-site events and/or outreach programming.
  • Work both independently and as part of a team with your intern cohort.
  • Complete a capstone project that helps us engage more authentically with our community.
What you will get out of this internship:
  • You will have accomplished a capstone project that contributes to the mission of the Library, has an impact on the community, and can be used in your resume or portfolio.
  • You will have made a difference.
  • A chance to share your passions and interests with youth and their families.
  • Discover which Harry Potter house you belong to, meet a unicorn, and wrangle some dinosaurs.
  • You will have had an amazing summer with some of the coolest Library staff on the planet.

SJCPL está buscando una persona creativa, entusiasta y automotivada para ayudar a desarrollar una programación de verano divertida para los jóvenes y sus familias. Como practicante, brindarás apoyo al personal para nuestro Desafío anual de lectura de verano, ayudarás a planificar e implementar programas, y proporcionará asistencia bilingüe al personal y a los clientes de la biblioteca. Esta persona tendrá la oportunidad de adquirir experiencia trabajando con los jóvenes y sus familias.
Un trabajo en SJCPL es una oportunidad para devolver a la comunidad mientras también ganar experiencia en la vida real en un entorno dinámico y desafiante. Las personas que trabajan en una biblioteca están comprometidas con el servicio público (y también pasar el día rodeados de libros).
Una vez aqui:
  • Te familiarizaras con la literatura, los materiales, los recursos y los servicios bibliotecarios de los niños.
  • Promoverás nuestro desafío anual de lectura de verano a las familias.
  • Ayudaras a planificar y presentar un programa como un tiempo de cuentas o actividad bilingüe para los jóvenes y sus familias, cree un arte comunitario o actividad multimedia, o comparta su pasión creando su propio proyecto único.
  • Ayudaras con programas de biblioteca para una variedad de grupos de edad
  • Visitaras las sucursales de biblioteca, ayudaras con eventos ocasionales fuera del sitio y/o programación de divulgación
  • Trabajaras de forma independiente y como parte de un equipo con un cohorte de practicantes
  • Completaras un Proyecto de capstone que nos ayudara a interactuar más auténticamente con nuestra comunidad
Lo que obtendrás de esta práctica:
  • Habrás realizado un proyecto capstone que contribuye a la misión de la biblioteca, tendras un impacto en la comunidad, y podras utilizar tu curriculum o portafolio.
  • Habras hecho una diferencia.
  • Una oportunidad de compartir tus pasiones e intereses con los jóvenes y sus familias
  • Descubrirás a que casa de Harry Potter perteneces, conocerás a un unicornio y pelea a algunos dinosaurios
  • Habrás tenido un verano increíble con algunos de los bibliotecarios y personal de la biblioteca más divertidos en el planeta.

Sasakawa USA Programs Internship for Summer-Fall 2021

Sasakawa Peace Foundation USA (Sasakawa USA) is a non-partisan 501(c)(3) organization dedicated to deepening the understanding of and strengthening the relationship between the U.S. and Japan for the benefit of a free and open international community. Its activities mainly focus on security and diplomacy, through exchanges, dialogue, analysis, publications, and networking.

The Programs Intern will work for and be supervised by the Director of Programs and will support various aspects of the programs that Sasakawa USA implements. This includes, but is not limited to, preliminary research, preparation and editing of documents, upkeep of data sets, writing event recaps, and assisting with event logistics.

This position is open until filled and requires a time commitment of no more than 29 hours per week on a flexible schedule. An ideal candidate will work 20-25 hours per week. Applications are accepted on a rolling basis only until the position is filled. Therefore, it is highly encouraged to apply sooner rather than later.

This internship will start around late-June and is expected to last until the end of December.

Please note, all internships are currently remote due to the coronavirus pandemic.

Requirements:

  • Current graduate students OR recent graduates with a Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Japanese Studies, International Relations, Security and Foreign Affairs, Political Science, East Asian Studies, or a related field;
  • Strong preference given to candidates with a demonstrated background in U.S.-Japan relations, Asia-Pacific security and defense, maritime security, or Pacific Islands;
  • Excellent English-language writing, editing, and research skills;
  • Japanese language ability a major plus;
  • Knowledge of professional decorum in use of social media;
  • Willingness to be proactive and take initiative;
  • Ability to work well with a team;
  • Strong computer skills including working knowledge of MS Office;
  • Well-organized with attention to detail and willingness to learn new skillsets;
  • Ability to carry out tasks independently while updating progress to a team;
  • Authorization to work in the United States;
  • Must reside in or around the Washington, DC Metro area.

Responsibilities:

  • Assist in SPFUSA event planning and logistics (including RSVP management, invitations, day of logistics, etc.);
  • Perform limited research on U.S.-Japan issues and background for new and current programs;
  • Monitor upcoming U.S.-Japan related events at think tanks and organizations, providing weekly reports to Programs team;
  • Attend conferences and think tank events (currently virtually) to produce notes and summaries;
  • Draft content for SPFUSA’s social media accounts and website;
  • Assist in updating and managing contact database for SPFUSA;
  • Other administrative responsibilities as needed.

Time/Compensation:

  • Up to 29 hours/week on a flexible schedule. The ideal candidate will work around 20-25 hours/week.
  • D.C. minimum wage ($15.20/hour).

To Apply:

To apply, please send resume, one-page writing sample, and cover letter to Ms. Shanti Shoji at sshoji[at]spfusa.org. Applications must be submitted via email to Ms. Shoji to be considered. Cover letters should detail your interest in Sasakawa USA, how your past experience relates to the above responsibilities, and your dates of availability. Include your name and “Sasakawa USA Intern” in the subject line of your email. Applications are accepted on a rolling basis only until the position is filled. Therefore, it is highly encouraged to apply sooner rather than later.

Interns for Technology and Information Systems will support IT at one of the six New Paradigm For Education schools. They will specifically help with COVID-related technology projects, including collecting student Chromebooks at the end of the school year, doing data entry for device inventory and other systems, and providing general technical assistance to educators, families, and staff at their assigned school.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITES

NPFE is on a mission to ensure that all students in Detroit achieve at the highest levels, supporting educational transformation through increased student achievement, fiscal responsibility, and community support.

Company Description

Microchip Technology Inc. is a leading provider of embedded control applications. Our product portfolio comprises general purpose and specialized 8-bit, 16-bit, and 32-bit microcontrollers, 32-bit microprocessors, field-programmable gate array (FPGA) products, a broad spectrum of high-performance linear, mixed-signal, power management, thermal management, radio frequency (RF), timing, safety, security, wired connectivity and wireless connectivity devices, as well as serial Electrically Erasable Programmable Read Only Memory (EEPROM), Serial Flash memories, Parallel Flash memories, and serial Static Random Access Memory (SRAM). We also license Flash-IP solutions that are incorporated in a broad range of products.

Job Description

::

Microchip is the leader in research and manufacture of high-reliability non-volatile Field Programmable Gate Arrays.

We are looking for a student who will work as a team member in Radiation Group on state-of-art Floating-Gate and ReRAM-based FPGAs. Technical tasks focus on device physics, circuit analyses, and system tests related to SOC Integrated Circuit response to Single Event Effects and Total Ionizing Dose effects.


Job Responsibilities:

  • Use HDL (Verilog) to design and test digital logic in FPGA.
  • Prepare samples for radiation tests.
  • Help to maintain and update the computer software for radiation testing.

Job Requirements

  • Preferably a junior in college majoring in Electrical Engineering or Computer Science.
  • Basic knowledge of Python, Verilog, R script
  • Excellent organization skill and attention to detail.
  • Effective communicator and creative problem-solver.
  • Ability to learn new technical areas quickly.
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced, demanding, dynamic environment.

Waymo is an autonomous driving technology company with a mission to make it safe and easy for people and things to get where they’re going. Since our start as the Google Self-Driving Car Project in 2009, Waymo has been focused on building the World’s Most Experienced Driver in hopes of improving the world's access to mobility while saving thousands of lives now lost to traffic crashes. Our Waymo Driver powers Waymo One, our fully autonomous ride-hailing service, as well as Waymo Via, our trucking and local delivery service. To date, Waymo has driven over 20 million miles autonomously on public roads across 25 U.S. cities and conducted over 20 billion miles of simulation testing.

Software Engineering builds the brains of Waymo's fully autonomous vehicles. Our software allows our vehicles to perceive the world around them, make the right decision for every situation, and deliver people safely to their destinations. We think deeply and solve complex technical challenges in areas like robotics, perception, decision-making and deep learning, while collaborating with hardware and systems engineers.

Waymo interns work alongside leaders in the industry on projects that deliver significant impact to the company. We believe learning is a two-way street: leveraging your knowledge while providing you with opportunities to expand your skill-set. Interns are an important part of our culture and our recruiting pipeline. Join us at Waymo for a fun and rewarding internship!

In this internship, you’ll:

  • Gain understanding of weather detection and estimation using test data or real-world logs
  • Research and implement solutions to detect and estimate weather onboard on autonomous vehicles
  • Exercise decision making regarding onboard sensor and architecture based on data analyses and modeling results

At a minimum we’d like you to have:

  • Must be enrolled in a MS/PHD program or already hold an advanced degree in computer science, robotics, electrical engineering, or similar technical field of study
  • Experience in at least one of: robotics, deep learning/machine learning, signal processing, estimation and modeling, and statistical analyses
  • Experience in data structures and advanced algorithms
  • Experience programming in Python

We prefer candidates to have:

  • Experience with audio signal processing and/or computational analyses of audio signals
  • Experience programming with tensorflow, or similar frameworks
  • Experience programming in C++

General Perks

  • Help solve challenging problems with a direct impact on the company
  • Competitive compensation packages with a housing/relocation bonus (if applicable)
  • Medical, dental, and vision insurance
  • Fun intern events and networking opportunities

Onsite Perks (These perks will only be applicable if the internship is on site)

  • Free breakfast, lunch, dinner, and snacks
  • Free access to Google shuttles
  • Onsite gym

Note: This fall internship position is planned to be located in our Ann Arbor office. However, as the situation around COVID-19 remains unclear, this position may switch to fully virtual. Your recruiter will discuss the available options during the interview process. We will accept resumes on a rolling basis until the role is filled. To be in consideration for multiple roles, you will need to apply to each one individually - please apply to the top 3 roles you are interested in.

position: Autonomous Systems & A.I. Developer Intern/Entry Level
description:
About PassiveLogic

PassiveLogic is disrupting the world of automation with the first fully autonomous platform for buildings. Our culture is built on bringing together the most talented engineers, thinkers, and creatives — backed by the world’s leading investors — working together to make the future a reality.

PassiveLogic’s infinitely configurable platform enables users to design their own custom autonomous systems. We've reinvented the fundamental principals of automation to replace legacy control logic with real-time control decisions at the edge, reducing the world’s carbon footprint, while paving the way for the future of smart cities. We are looking for team members who have a passion for technology and want to work on cutting-edge problems with real-world solutions.

This is an internship position, with a potential full-time follow-on for the right candidate. Opportunity for involvement is only limited by your enthusiasm.

What you will be doing:

The AI & Autonomous Systems Intern will be a meaningful part of the team developing real technology, prototypes, and solve real-world engineering and product development problems. Developing autonomous, heuristic, and regression data mining solutions for real-time system control and multi-dimensional path estimation. Other tasks include implementing physical model based “digital twins” of real-world analogs, interfacing with system object model and developing interfaces for electro-mechanical control systems.

You must have:

  • Strong programming skills (e.g. Python, R, C++, Swift, etc)
  • Strong experience using Deep Learning, Machine Learning, and Differentiable Programming
  • Experience with reinforcement learning, route-finding, and search algorithms
  • Good analysis and problem-solving skills
  • Experience with Tensorflow or other deep learning framework

You should have:

  • Systems programming experience (C, C++, Swift, Rust, etc)
  • Experience with data mining methodologies & statistical methods
  • Experience with modeling and algorithm development

It’s helpful to have:

  • Fundamentals of building energy and/or electro-mechanical systems
  • Experience with autonomous systems, energy systems, or mechanical-electrical control experience
  • Experience with Swift (even better, Swift for Tensorflow)

Compensation, Perks, & Benefits

  • Competitive compensation
  • Medical, dental, vision
  • Food, drinks, and catered lunches
  • Free ski passes available (We are at the base of Big Cottonwood Canyon)
  • Free National Park passes available
  • Must be diligent and get work done, but we do respect powder days
  • We can support academic credits for students
  • Must be diligent and get work done, but we do respect powder days

To apply for this position:

With your cover letter and resume, include a description of a project (of any type) you personally created, devised, built, managed, organized, or designed that was of your own self-initiative.

Apply here!

Unsolicited resumes sent to PassiveLogic, including unsolicited resumes sent to PassiveLogic business mailing address, fax machine, email address, or directly to PassiveLogic employees, will be considered PassiveLogic property. PassiveLogic will NOT pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume.

What you do at AMD changes everything

At AMD, we push the boundaries of what is possible. We believe in changing the world for the better by driving innovation in high-performance computing, graphics, and visualization technologies – building blocks for gaming, immersive platforms, and the data center.

Developing great technology takes more than talent: it takes amazing people who understand collaboration, respect, and who will go the “extra mile” to achieve unthinkable results. It takes people who have the passion and desire to disrupt the status quo, push boundaries, deliver innovation, and change the world. If you have this type of passion, we invite you to take a look at the opportunities available to come join our team.

The Primary Role of this position is:

Working with a mentor, develop test programs for debugging, characterizing and production testing next-generation AMD processors. Work on Automated Test Equipment (ATE) platforms and System Level Test (SLT) platforms. Debug test infrastructure issues including test hardware, test software, and product-specific IP. Develop software tools and scripts that support Test process.

Support overall compatibility, compliance, and test coverage of processors from product definition through product qualification and into high volume production by developing product specific test hardware, software and diagnostics. The test platforms and test infrastructure use various coding and scripting languages like Java, C++, C, Python, PERL, and Ruby to manipulate the device under test to ensure proper device functionality.

Potential roles of a Product Development Co-op include:

  • Develops and implements test programs/software to test and analyze AMD products.
  • Develops test requirements and specifications.
  • Develops software tools and scripts that support test process, program debug/audit, test time analysis etc.
  • Performs logic and circuit design verification via software and hardware.
  • Works with product engineering, characterization and platform debug teams to define and debug existing and new products.
  • Debugs test infrastructure issues in hardware, software, device, or manufacturing flow domains.
  • Support product improvement activities including driving cost reduction and yield improvement initiatives and resolving quality issues.
  • Works on related projects and/or assignments as needed.

Qualifications:

Years of experience and education: Candidates will be enrolled in a bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or Electrical Engineering.

Required Skills:

  • Experience with C++ or other high-level software programming languages (Java, C, C#)
  • Courses in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Digital Logic, Circuit Theory
  • Familiar with Linux or Unix Operating Systems
  • Familiar with Microsoft standard apps (i.e. Office), Microsoft Windows Operating Systems

Preferred Skills:

  • Scripting language experience with Perl, Ruby, shell script, or similar
  • Experience in the XP, AGILE, Scrum, and/or Kanban programming paradigms.

Experience with revision control (SVN, CVS,RCS or similar) on a large software project

position: Cold Regions Research & Engineering Laboratory - 2021 Spring/Summer Intern Program
description:
Organization
U.S. Department of Defense (DOD)
Reference Code
ERDC-CRREL-2021-0001
How to Apply


Description

The U.S. Army Cold Regions Research and Engineering Laboratory (CRREL) (est. February 1, 1961) solves interdisciplinary, strategically important problems for the Corps of Engineers, Army, Department of Defense, and the Nation. CRREL discovers, develops, and delivers advanced and applied science and engineering to complex environments, materials, and processes in all seasons and climates. The U.S. Army Engineer Research and Development Center, CRREL is a national resource focused on solving specific, customer-driven problems and conducting innovative research in five program areas - Civil Works - Engineered Resilient Systems - Environmental Quality & Installations - Geospatial Research & Engineering - Military Engineering.

What will I be doing?

You will research alongside CRREL staff and primary researchers. Under the guidance of a mentor, you will gain hands-on experience in a real world laboratory environment, in addition to modern research technologies and techniques. This experience will also focus on personal career development in the areas of STEM, providing opportunities to collaborate and network with other students and researchers across all STEM disciplines.

Why should I apply?

This fellowship provides the opportunity to independently utilize your skills and engage with experts in innovative ideas to move the proposed research forward. There are multiple opportunities available to engage in your applied research and evaluation interests.

Research areas include:

  • Science and technology for national security
  • Unique, multidisciplinary expertise related to the Earth’s cold regions
  • Biogeochemical Sciences
  • Force Projection and Sustainment
  • Remote Sensing/Geographic Information Systems Center of Expertise
    • U.S. Ice Jam Database
    • U.S. National Levee Database
  • Signature Physics
  • Terrestrial and Cryospheric Sciences

Where will I be located? Hanover, NH

What is the anticipated start date?

ERDC-CRREL is ready to make appointments immediately. Exact start dates will be determined at the time of selection and in coordination with the selected candidates. Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis and fellowships will be filled as qualified candidates are identified.

What are the benefits?

You will receive a stipend to be determined by ERDC-CRREL. Stipends are typically based on the participant’s academic standing, discipline, experience, and research facility location. Other benefits may include the following:

  • Health Insurance Supplement. Participants are eligible to purchase health insurance through ORISE.
  • Relocation Allowance
  • Training and Travel Allowance

This ORISE appointment is a spring/summer opportunity. Appointments may be extended depending on funding availability, project assignment, program rules, and availability of the participant.

Nature of the Appointment

You will not enter into an employee/employer relationship with ORISE, ORAU, DOD, or any other office or agency. Instead, you will be affiliated with ORISE for the administration of the appointment through the ORISE appointment letter and Terms of Appointment.

Qualifications

This research opportunity is open to STEM students and recent graduates who are interested on hands-on experience in a real world laboratory environment. The focus on personal career development in the areas of STEM, providing opportunities to collaborate and network with other students and researchers across all STEM disciplines.

A complete application consists of:

  • Zintellect profile
  • Essay Questions - The application includes questions specific to the opportunity.
  • Academic Records - For this opportunity, an official transcript or copy of the student academic records printed by the applicant or by academic advisors from internal institution systems may be submitted.
  • Current Resume/CV
  • One Recommendation - Applicants are required to provide contact information for at least one recommendation. You are encouraged to request a recommendation from a professional who can speak to your abilities and potential for success as well as your scientific capabilities and personal characteristics. Recommendation requests must be sent through the Zintellect application system. Recommenders will be asked to complete a recommendation in Zintellect. Letters of recommendation submitted via email will not be accepted.

Fluidra is seeking multiple Software Engineering Interns that will work with our IoT Cloud, Mobile and Test teams at our North American Headquarters in Carlsbad, CA. This is a great opportunity to get hands on experience working with products that involve mechanical, electrical and software components. Come be a part of a growing organization for the summer of 2021!

WHY WORK FOR FLUIDRA?


We are a leader in the global pool industry. Our portfolio includes some of the most trusted brands; we offer our customers an expansive array of products across both the residential and commercial pool and wellness markets; and we have strong geographical footprint with operations in over 45 countries. With our merger with Zodiac, we now have over 5,500 employees and the combined resources to accelerate innovation in critical areas like energy-efficiency, robotics and the Internet of Things.

We are guided by clear values and come to work every day with a simple and direct mission in mind: To create the perfect pool and wellness experience. By staying focused on this mission, we will create value for all our stakeholders–customers, pool owners, investors and employees.

We own a portfolio of some of the industry’s most recognized and trusted brands, including Jandy®, AstralPool®, Polaris®, Cepex®, Zodiac®, CTX Professional® and Gre®.

WHAT YOU WILL CONTRIBUTE

The Software Engineering Intern, Cloud Platform will be responsible for working with our senior engineers with research and development related to building APIs and Data pipeline for Fluidra’s connected products. As a Software Engineering Intern, you will get to work with a fun-loving team working on state-of-the-art cloud platform utilizing the latest AWS services. This team is responsible for areas of device to cloud connection, data ingestion, data analytics, infrastructure and DevOps along with APIs for command and control. You will also work with other teams building native, hybrid and web front-end apps in an Agile environment. Additionally, you will:

As an Engineering intern, you will have the following key responsibilities:

  • You will design, develop, code and test software systems for Fluidra’s next generation of connected products.
  • Commit to active learning and contributing to the cloud team’s objectives
  • Collaborate with team in an agile Scrum framework, attend daily scrum meetings, provide updates and meet the sprint goals
WHAT WE SEEK
  • Familiarity with object-oriented programming concepts, large-scale software architecture, networking and distributed systems, and AWS/Unix environments
  • Familiarity with some of the following programming languages including but not limited to NodeJS, Java, Python or TypeScript
  • Familiarity with REST API and microservices
  • Familiarity with tools and technologies like Git, Jenkins, AWS, Docker etc.
  • Highlight your project portfolio on GitHub or contribution to open source
  • You enjoy collaborating with others in a fast-paced environment
  • Strong communication skills, verbal and written
EDUCATION

Actively pursuing a Bachelor’s, Master’s, or PhD in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Mathematics or a related technical field, and a strong record of academic achievement.

WHAT WE OFFER

An exciting opportunity to dive in and begin your career with a company that offers a competitive total rewards package that includes:

 Alternate work week schedule (EVERY OTHER FRIDAY OFF!)
On-site self-service café / free gourmet coffee stations
 Company sponsored FUN events!
 On-site gym, ping-pong, foosball, outdoor bocce ball court, BBQ & firepit

In the pursuit of product excellence, Fluidra takes its corporate values to heart. We implement these guiding principles in everything we do: passion for success, honesty & trust, customer collaboration, team work, learn and adapt, excellence and Innovation.

For a deeper dive in to our corporate culture, click here.

Tinder empowers users around the world to create new connections that otherwise might never have been possible. We build products that bring people together. We are dedicated to delivering innovative products through early and continuous delivery of high quality software consumed by millions. We're a small team with a focus on individual responsibility and rapid development. If you're an intelligent and highly ambitious up-and-coming Software Engineer, we want to talk to you!

What you'll do:

    • Collaborate on the design of our newest Tinder features and implement those features in a robust and maintainable fashion
    • Experiment with new technologies, looking to innovate and improve wherever possible
    • Write unit and integration tests to ensure features never break
    • Support the full mobile app lifecycle from design to release

What we're looking for:

    • Must be currently enrolled in a full-time degree program pursuing a BS/BA, MS, or PhD in Computer Science or a related technical field with a graduation date no earlier than December 2021
    • Prior internship experience and/or a relevant project list.
    • Strong CS Fundamentals
    • Proficiency with Java or Kotlin
    • Prior mobile development experience

Bonus points if:

    • You have prior Android internship experience
    • You have published your own android app in the play store
    • Contribution to open source projects related to android

As part of our team, you’ll enjoy:

  • Working on a product that has an immediate impact on people’s lives all around the world
  • Collaborating with a team of creative, fun and driven colleagues
  • Comprehensive health coverage, competitive salary, 401(k) employer match
  • Other perks and wellness benefits like a fitness membership subsidy, paid concierge medical membership, pet insurance offerings, and a commuter subsidy
  • Access to mental health resources

At Tinder, we don’t just accept difference — we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our product, and our community. We champion and encourage those who bring different perspectives, ideas, and creativity to join our team dedicated to bringing people together across the globe.
